  56def func_name():
  57    """
  58    helper method to return name of caller
  59    """
  60    return sys._getframe(1).f_code.co_name

  63class BootLoaderConfigGrub2(BootLoaderConfigBase):
  64    """
  65    **grub2 bootloader configuration.**
  66    """
  67    def post_init(self, custom_args):
  68        """
  69        grub2 post initialization method
  70
  71        :param dict custom_args:
  72            Contains grub config arguments
  73
  74            .. code:: python
  75
  76                {'grub_directory_name': 'grub|grub2'}
  77        """
  78        self.host_key_certificates = self.xml_state.get_host_key_certificates()
  79        self.efi_csm = True if self.xml_state.build_type.get_eficsm() is None \
  80            else self.xml_state.build_type.get_eficsm()
  81        self.custom_args = custom_args
  82        self.config_options = []
  83        arch = Defaults.get_platform_name()
  84        if arch == 'x86_64':
  85            # grub2 support for bios and efi systems
  86            self.arch = arch
  87        elif arch == 'loongarch64':
  88            # grub2 support for efi systems
  89            self.arch = arch
  90        elif arch.startswith('ppc64'):
  91            # grub2 support for ofw and opal systems
  92            self.arch = arch
  93        elif arch == 'ix86':
  94            # grub2 support for bios systems
  95            self.arch = arch
  96        elif arch == 'aarch64' or arch.startswith('arm'):
  97            # grub2 support for efi systems
  98            self.arch = arch
  99        elif arch.startswith('s390'):
 100            # grub2 support for s390x systems
 101            self.arch = arch
 102        elif arch == 'riscv64':
 103            # grub2 support for efi systems
 104            self.arch = arch
 105        else:
 106            raise KiwiBootLoaderGrubPlatformError(
 107                f'host architecture {arch} not supported for grub2 setup'
 108            )
 109
 110        if self.custom_args and 'grub_directory_name' in self.custom_args:
 111            self.boot_directory_name = self.custom_args['grub_directory_name']
 112        else:
 113            self.boot_directory_name = 'grub'
 114
 115        if self.custom_args and 'grub_load_command' in self.custom_args:
 116            self.grub_load = self.custom_args['grub_load_command']
 117        else:
 118            self.grub_load = 'source'
 119
 120        if self.custom_args and 'config_options' in self.custom_args:
 121            self.config_options = self.custom_args['config_options']
 122
 123        # This default output terminal type will change to console
 124        # with the next major kiwi version update. Also see:
 125        # https://github.com/OSInside/kiwi/issues/2494
 126        self.terminal_output = \
 127            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_console()[0] or 'gfxterm'
 128
 129        self.terminal_input = \
 130            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_console()[1] or 'console'
 131
 132        self.gfxmode = self.get_gfxmode('grub2')
 133        self.theme = self.get_boot_theme()
 134        self.timeout = self.get_boot_timeout_seconds()
 135        self.bootpartition = self.xml_state.build_type.get_bootpartition()
 136        self.timeout_style = \
 137            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_timeout_style()
 138        self.displayname = self.xml_state.xml_data.get_displayname()
 139        self.bls = self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_bls()
 140        self.serial_line_setup = \
 141            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_serial_line_setup()
 142        self.continue_on_timeout = self.get_continue_on_timeout()
 143        self.failsafe_boot = self.failsafe_boot_entry_requested()
 144        self.mediacheck_boot = self.xml_state.build_type.get_mediacheck()
 145        self.xen_guest = self.xml_state.is_xen_guest()
 146        self.persistency_type = \
 147            self.xml_state.build_type.get_devicepersistency()
 148        self.firmware = FirmWare(
 149            self.xml_state
 150        )
 151        self.target_table_type = self.firmware.get_partition_table_type()
 152
 153        self.live_type = self.xml_state.build_type.get_flags()
 154        if not self.live_type:
 155            self.live_type = Defaults.get_default_live_iso_type()
 156
 157        self.volume_id = self.xml_state.build_type.get_volid() or \
 158            Defaults.get_volume_id()
 159        self.install_volid = self.xml_state.build_type.get_volid() or \
 160            Defaults.get_install_volume_id()
 161        self.use_disk_password = \
 162            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_use_disk_password()
 163
 164        self.live_boot_options = [
 165            'root=live:CDLABEL={0}'.format(self.volume_id),
 166            'rd.live.image'
 167        ]
 168        self.install_boot_options = [
 169            'loglevel=0'
 170        ]
 171        if self.xml_state.get_initrd_system() == 'dracut':
 172            self.install_boot_options.append(
 173                'root=install:CDLABEL={0}'.format(self.install_volid)
 174            )
 175        if self.xml_state.build_type.get_hybridpersistent():
 176            self.live_boot_options += \
 177                Defaults.get_live_iso_persistent_boot_options(
 178                    self.xml_state.build_type.get_hybridpersistent_filesystem()
 179                )
 180
 181        if self.xml_state.is_xen_server():
 182            self.multiboot = True
 183        elif self.xen_guest:
 184            self.multiboot = False
 185        else:
 186            self.multiboot = False
 187
 188        self.grub2 = BootLoaderTemplateGrub2()
 189        self.config = None
 190        self.efi_boot_path = None
 191        self.cmdline_failsafe = None
 192        self.root_reference = None
 193        self.cmdline = None
 194        self.iso_boot = False
 195        self.early_boot_script_efi = None
 196
 197    def write(self):
 198        """
 199        Write bootloader configuration
 200
 201        * writes grub.cfg template by KIWI if template system is used
 202        * creates an embedded fat efi image for EFI ISO boot
 203        """
 204        if self.config:
 205            log.info('Writing KIWI template grub.cfg file')
 206            config_dir = self._get_grub2_boot_path()
 207            config_file = config_dir + '/grub.cfg'
 208            Path.create(config_dir)
 209            with open(config_file, 'w') as config:
 210                config.write(self.config)
 211
 212    def setup_sysconfig_bootloader(self):
 213        raise NotImplementedError
 214
 215    def write_meta_data(
 216        self, root_device=None, write_device=None, boot_options=''
 217    ):
 218        """
 219        Write bootloader setup meta data files
 220
 221        * cmdline arguments initialization
 222        * etc/default/grub setup file
 223        * etc/default/zipl2grub.conf.in (s390 only)
 224        * etc/sysconfig/bootloader
 225
 226        :param string root_device: root device node
 227        :param string write_device: overlay root write device node
 228        :param string boot_options: kernel options as string
 229        :param bool iso_boot: indicate target is an ISO
 230        """
 231        self.cmdline = ' '.join(
 232            [self.get_boot_cmdline(root_device, write_device), boot_options]
 233        )
 234        self.cmdline_failsafe = ' '.join(
 235            [self.cmdline, Defaults.get_failsafe_kernel_options(), boot_options]
 236        )
 237        self.root_reference = self._get_root_cmdline_parameter(
 238            root_device
 239        )
 240
 241        self._setup_default_grub()
 242        self._setup_sysconfig_bootloader()
 243        if self.arch.startswith('s390'):
 244            self._setup_zipl2grub_conf()
 245
 246    def setup_disk_image_config(
 247        self, boot_uuid=None, root_uuid=None, hypervisor=None,
 248        kernel=None, initrd=None, boot_options={}
 249    ):
 250        """
 251        Create grub2 config file to boot from disk using grub2-mkconfig
 252
 253        :param string boot_uuid: unused
 254        :param string root_uuid: unused
 255        :param string hypervisor: unused
 256        :param string kernel: unused
 257        :param string initrd: unused
 258        :param dict boot_options:
 259
 260        options dictionary that has to contain the root and boot
 261        device and optional volume configuration. KIWI has to
 262        mount the system prior to run grub2-mkconfig.
 263
 264        .. code:: python
 265
 266            {
 267                'root_device': string,
 268                'boot_device': string,
 269                'efi_device': string,
 270                'system_volumes':
 271                    volume_manager_instance.get_volumes(),
 272                'system_root_volume':
 273                    volume_manager_instance.get_root_volume_name()
 274            }
 275        """
 276        self._mount_system(
 277            boot_options.get('root_device'),
 278            boot_options.get('boot_device'),
 279            boot_options.get('efi_device'),
 280            boot_options.get('system_volumes'),
 281            boot_options.get('system_root_volume')
 282        )
 283        config_file = os.sep.join(
 284            [
 285                self.root_mount.mountpoint, 'boot',
 286                self.boot_directory_name, 'grub.cfg'
 287            ]
 288        )
 289        # Setup/Update loader environment
 290        self._setup_loader_variables()
 291
 292        # Disable os-prober, it takes information from the host it
 293        # runs on which is not necessarily matching with the image
 294        os.environ.update({'GRUB_DISABLE_OS_PROBER': 'true'})
 295        Command.run(
 296            [
 297                'chroot', self.root_mount.mountpoint,
 298                os.path.basename(self._get_grub2_mkconfig_tool()), '-o',
 299                config_file.replace(self.root_mount.mountpoint, '')
 300            ], os.environ
 301        )
 302        if boot_options.get('root_device') != boot_options.get('boot_device'):
 303            # Create a boot -> . link on the boot partition.
 304            # The link is useful if the grub mkconfig command
 305            # references all boot files from /boot/... even if
 306            # an extra boot partition should cause it to read the
 307            # data from the toplevel
 308            bash_command = [
 309                'cd', os.sep.join([self.root_mount.mountpoint, 'boot']), '&&',
 310                'rm', '-f', 'boot', '&&',
 311                'ln', '-s', '.', 'boot'
 312            ]
 313            # not every filesystem supports symlinks, and the link is optional
 314            # therefore don't fail in case the link cannot be created
 315            Command.run(
 316                ['bash', '-c', ' '.join(bash_command)], raise_on_error=False
 317            )
 318
 319        # Create UKI image if requested
 320        dracut_setup = self.xml_state.get_dracut_config('setup')
 321        if dracut_setup.uefi:
 322            boot_image = boot_options.get('boot_image')
 323            if boot_image:
 324                efi_uki_path = \
 325                    f'{self.root_mount.mountpoint}/boot/efi/EFI/Linux/'
 326                Path.create(efi_uki_path)
 327                uki_image = boot_image.create_uki(self.cmdline)
 328                Command.run(
 329                    ['mv', uki_image, efi_uki_path]
 330                )
 331
 332        # Patch the written grub config file to actually work:
 333        # Unfortunately the grub tooling has several bugs and issues
 334        # which prevents it to work in image build environments.
 335        # More details can be found in the individual methods.
 336        # One fine day the following fix methods can hopefully
 337        # be deleted...
 338        self._fix_grub_root_device_reference(config_file, boot_options)
 339        self._fix_grub_loader_entries_boot_cmdline()
 340        self._fix_grub_loader_entries_linux_and_initrd_paths()
 341
 342        if self.firmware.efi_mode() and self.early_boot_script_efi:
 343            self._copy_grub_config_to_efi_path(
 344                self.efi_mount.mountpoint, self.early_boot_script_efi
 345            )
 346        self._umount_system()
 347
 348    def setup_install_image_config(
 349        self, mbrid, hypervisor='xen.gz', kernel='linux', initrd='initrd'
 350    ):
 351        """
 352        Create grub2 config file to boot from an ISO install image
 353
 354        :param string mbrid: mbrid file name on boot device
 355        :param string hypervisor: hypervisor name
 356        :param string kernel: kernel name
 357        :param string initrd: initrd name
 358        """
 359        log.info('Creating grub2 install config file from template')
 360        self.iso_boot = True
 361        has_graphics = False
 362        has_serial = False
 363        if 'gfxterm' in self.terminal_output:
 364            has_graphics = True
 365        if 'serial' in self.terminal_output or 'serial' in self.terminal_input:
 366            has_serial = True
 367        parameters = {
 368            'search_params': '--file --set=root /boot/' + mbrid.get_id(),
 369            'default_boot': self.get_install_image_boot_default(),
 370            'kernel_file': kernel,
 371            'initrd_file': initrd,
 372            'boot_options': ' '.join(
 373                [self.cmdline] + self.install_boot_options
 374            ),
 375            'failsafe_boot_options': ' '.join(
 376                [self.cmdline_failsafe] + self.install_boot_options
 377            ),
 378            'gfxmode': self.gfxmode,
 379            'theme': self.theme,
 380            'boot_timeout': self.timeout,
 381            'boot_timeout_style': self.timeout_style or 'menu',
 382            'serial_line_setup': self.serial_line_setup or '',
 383            'title': self.get_menu_entry_install_title(),
 384            'bootpath': self.get_boot_path('iso'),
 385            'boot_directory_name': self.boot_directory_name,
 386            'efi_image_name': Defaults.get_efi_image_name(self.arch),
 387            'terminal_input': self.terminal_input,
 388            'terminal_output': self.terminal_output
 389        }
 390        custom_template_path = self._get_custom_template()
 391        if custom_template_path:
 392            log.info('--> Using custom boot template')
 393            with open(custom_template_path) as custom_template_file:
 394                template = Template(custom_template_file.read())
 395        elif self.multiboot:
 396            log.info('--> Using multiboot install template')
 397            parameters['hypervisor'] = hypervisor
 398            template = self.grub2.get_multiboot_install_template(
 399                self.failsafe_boot, has_graphics, has_serial,
 400                self.continue_on_timeout, self._has_btrfs_relative_path()
 401            )
 402        else:
 403            log.info('--> Using standard boot install template')
 404            template = self.grub2.get_install_template(
 405                self.failsafe_boot, has_graphics, has_serial,
 406                self.continue_on_timeout, self._has_btrfs_relative_path()
 407            )
 408        try:
 409            self.config = template.substitute(parameters)
 410        except Exception as e:
 411            raise KiwiTemplateError(
 412                f'{type(e).__name__}: {format(e)}'
 413            )
 414        if self.firmware.efi_mode() and self.early_boot_script_efi:
 415            self._copy_grub_config_to_efi_path(
 416                self.boot_dir, self.early_boot_script_efi, 'iso'
 417            )
 418
 419    def setup_live_image_config(
 420        self, mbrid: SystemIdentifier, hypervisor='xen.gz', kernel='linux', initrd='initrd'
 421    ):
 422        """
 423        Create grub2 config file to boot a live media ISO image
 424
 425        :param string mbrid: mbrid file name on boot device
 426        :param string hypervisor: hypervisor name
 427        :param string kernel: kernel name
 428        :param string initrd: initrd name
 429        """
 430        log.info('Creating grub2 live ISO config file from template')
 431        self.iso_boot = True
 432        has_graphics = False
 433        has_serial = False
 434        if 'gfxterm' in self.terminal_output:
 435            has_graphics = True
 436        if 'serial' in self.terminal_output or 'serial' in self.terminal_input:
 437            has_serial = True
 438        parameters = {
 439            'search_params': '--file --set=root /boot/' + mbrid.get_id(),
 440            'default_boot': '0',
 441            'kernel_file': kernel,
 442            'initrd_file': initrd,
 443            'boot_options': ' '.join(
 444                [self.cmdline] + self.live_boot_options
 445            ),
 446            'failsafe_boot_options': ' '.join(
 447                [self.cmdline_failsafe] + self.live_boot_options
 448            ),
 449            'gfxmode': self.gfxmode,
 450            'theme': self.theme,
 451            'boot_timeout': self.timeout,
 452            'boot_timeout_style': self.timeout_style or 'menu',
 453            'serial_line_setup': self.serial_line_setup or '',
 454            'title': self.get_menu_entry_title(plain=True),
 455            'bootpath': self.get_boot_path('iso'),
 456            'boot_directory_name': self.boot_directory_name,
 457            'efi_image_name': Defaults.get_efi_image_name(self.arch),
 458            'terminal_input': self.terminal_input,
 459            'terminal_output': self.terminal_output
 460        }
 461        custom_template_path = self._get_custom_template()
 462        if custom_template_path:
 463            log.info('--> Using custom boot template')
 464            with open(custom_template_path) as custom_template_file:
 465                template = Template(custom_template_file.read())
 466        elif self.multiboot:
 467            log.info('--> Using multiboot template')
 468            parameters['hypervisor'] = hypervisor
 469            template = self.grub2.get_multiboot_iso_template(
 470                self.failsafe_boot, has_graphics, has_serial,
 471                self.mediacheck_boot, self._has_btrfs_relative_path()
 472            )
 473        else:
 474            log.info('--> Using standard boot template')
 475            template = self.grub2.get_iso_template(
 476                self.failsafe_boot, has_graphics, has_serial,
 477                self.mediacheck_boot, self._has_btrfs_relative_path()
 478            )
 479        try:
 480            self.config = template.substitute(parameters)
 481        except Exception as e:
 482            raise KiwiTemplateError(
 483                f'{type(e).__name__}: {format(e)}'
 484            )
 485        if self.firmware.efi_mode() and self.early_boot_script_efi:
 486            self._copy_grub_config_to_efi_path(
 487                self.boot_dir, self.early_boot_script_efi, 'iso'
 488            )
 489
 490    def setup_install_boot_images(
 491        self, mbrid: SystemIdentifier, lookup_path: str = None
 492    ) -> None:
 493        """
 494        Create/Provide grub2 boot images and metadata
 495
 496        In order to boot from the ISO grub2 modules, images and theme
 497        data needs to be created and provided at the correct place on
 498        the iso filesystem
 499
 500        :param string mbrid: mbrid file name on boot device
 501        :param string lookup_path: custom module lookup path
 502        """
 503        log.info('Creating grub2 bootloader images')
 504        if self.firmware.efi_mode():
 505            self.efi_boot_path = self.create_efi_path(in_sub_dir='')
 506
 507        log.info('--> Creating identifier file %s', mbrid.get_id())
 508        grub_boot_path = self._get_grub2_boot_path()
 509        Path.create(
 510            grub_boot_path
 511        )
 512        mbrid.write(
 513            self.boot_dir + '/boot/' + mbrid.get_id()
 514        )
 515        mbrid.write(
 516            self.boot_dir + '/boot/mbrid'
 517        )
 518
 519        self._copy_theme_data_to_boot_directory(lookup_path, 'iso')
 520
 521        if self._supports_platform_modules():
 522            self._copy_bios_modules_to_boot_directory(lookup_path)
 523            self._setup_platform_image(mbrid=mbrid, lookup_path=lookup_path)
 524
 525        if self.firmware.efi_mode():
 526            self._setup_EFI_path(lookup_path)
 527
 528        if self.firmware.efi_mode() == 'efi':
 529            self._setup_efi_image(
 530                mbrid=mbrid, lookup_path=lookup_path, target_type='iso'
 531            )
 532            self._copy_efi_modules_to_boot_directory(lookup_path)
 533        elif self.firmware.efi_mode() == 'uefi':
 534            self._setup_secure_boot_efi_image(
 535                lookup_path=lookup_path, mbrid=mbrid, target_type='iso'
 536            )
 537
 538        log.info('--> Creating loopback config')
 539        loopback_file = os.path.normpath(
 540            os.sep.join([grub_boot_path, 'loopback.cfg'])
 541        )
 542        self._create_loopback_config(
 543            loopback_file
 544        )
 545
 546    def setup_live_boot_images(self, mbrid: SystemIdentifier, lookup_path=None):
 547        """
 548        Create/Provide grub2 boot images and metadata
 549
 550        Calls setup_install_boot_images because no different action required
 551        """
 552        self.setup_install_boot_images(mbrid, lookup_path)
 553
 554    def setup_disk_boot_images(
 555        self, boot_uuid, efi_uuid=None, lookup_path=None
 556    ):
 557        """
 558        Create/Provide grub2 boot images and metadata
 559
 560        In order to boot from the disk grub2 modules, images and theme
 561        data needs to be created and provided at the correct place in
 562        the filesystem
 563
 564        :param string boot_uuid: boot device UUID
 565        :param string lookup_path: custom module lookup path
 566        """
 567        log.info('Creating grub2 bootloader images')
 568
 569        if self.firmware.efi_mode():
 570            self.efi_boot_path = self.create_efi_path()
 571
 572        self._copy_theme_data_to_boot_directory(lookup_path, 'disk')
 573
 574        if not self.xen_guest and self._supports_platform_modules():
 575            self._copy_bios_modules_to_boot_directory(lookup_path)
 576
 577        if self.firmware.efi_mode() == 'efi':
 578            self._setup_efi_image(
 579                uuid=boot_uuid, efi_uuid=efi_uuid, lookup_path=lookup_path
 580            )
 581            self._copy_efi_modules_to_boot_directory(lookup_path)
 582        elif self.firmware.efi_mode() == 'uefi':
 583            if not self._get_shim_install():
 584                self._setup_secure_boot_efi_image(
 585                    lookup_path=lookup_path, uuid=boot_uuid, efi_uuid=efi_uuid
 586                )
 587
 588        if self.xen_guest:
 589            self._copy_xen_modules_to_boot_directory(lookup_path)
 590
 591    def _copy_grub_config_to_efi_path(
 592        self, root_path, config_file, target_type='disk'
 593    ):
 594        efi_boot_path = Defaults.get_shim_vendor_directory(
 595            root_path
 596        )
 597        if not efi_boot_path:
 598            # not all distributors installs a vendor directory but
 599            # have them in their encoded early boot script. Thus
 600            # the following code tries to look up the vendor string
 601            # from the signed grub binary
 602            grub_images = Defaults.get_signed_grub_loader(
 603                self.root_dir, target_type
 604            )
 605            for grub_image in grub_images:
 606                if grub_image and grub_image.filename:
 607                    strings_abspath = Path.which(
 608                        'strings', access_mode=os.X_OK
 609                    )
 610                    if not strings_abspath:
 611                        raise KiwiCommandNotFound(
 612                            'strings command not found on buildhost'
 613                        )
 614                    bash_command = [
 615                        strings_abspath,
 616                        grub_image.filename, '|', 'grep', r'EFI\/'
 617                    ]
 618                    efi_boot_path = Command.run(
 619                        ['bash', '-c', ' '.join(bash_command)],
 620                        raise_on_error=False, raise_on_command_not_found=True
 621                    ).output
 622                    if efi_boot_path:
 623                        efi_boot_path = os.path.normpath(
 624                            os.sep.join([root_path, efi_boot_path.strip()])
 625                        )
 626        if not efi_boot_path:
 627            efi_boot_path = os.path.normpath(
 628                os.sep.join([root_path, 'EFI/BOOT'])
 629            )
 630        Path.create(efi_boot_path)
 631        grub_config_file_for_efi_boot = os.sep.join(
 632            [efi_boot_path, 'grub.cfg']
 633        )
 634        if config_file != grub_config_file_for_efi_boot:
 635            log.info(
 636                'Copying {0} -> {1} to be found by EFI'.format(
 637                    config_file, grub_config_file_for_efi_boot
 638                )
 639            )
 640            shutil.copy2(
 641                config_file, grub_config_file_for_efi_boot
 642            )
 643
 644    def _supports_platform_modules(self):
 645        if self.efi_csm and (
 646            self.arch == 'ix86' or self.arch == 'x86_64' or Defaults.is_ppc64_arch(self.arch)
 647        ):
 648            return True
 649        return False
 650
 651    def _setup_sysconfig_bootloader(self):
 652        """
 653        Create or update etc/sysconfig/bootloader for the following
 654        parameters. Please note this file is consumed by perl-bootloader
 655        only and marked for deletion with the next major release of
 656        kiwi because not a mainline grub config file.
 657
 658        * LOADER_TYPE
 659        * LOADER_LOCATION
 660        * DEFAULT_APPEND
 661        * FAILSAFE_APPEND
 662        * SECURE_BOOT
 663        * TRUSTED_BOOT
 664        """
 665        sysconfig_bootloader_entries = {
 666            'LOADER_TYPE':
 667                'grub2-efi' if self.firmware.efi_mode() else 'grub2',
 668            'LOADER_LOCATION':
 669                'none' if self.firmware.efi_mode() else 'mbr'
 670        }
 671        if self.bls:
 672            sysconfig_bootloader_entries['LOADER_TYPE'] = 'grub2-bls'
 673        if '--set-trusted-boot' in self.config_options:
 674            sysconfig_bootloader_entries['TRUSTED_BOOT'] = 'yes'
 675        if self.firmware.efi_mode() == 'uefi':
 676            sysconfig_bootloader_entries['SECURE_BOOT'] = 'yes'
 677        elif self.firmware.efi_mode() == 'efi':
 678            sysconfig_bootloader_entries['SECURE_BOOT'] = 'no'
 679        if self.cmdline:
 680            sysconfig_bootloader_entries['DEFAULT_APPEND'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 681                self.cmdline
 682            )
 683        if self.cmdline_failsafe:
 684            sysconfig_bootloader_entries['FAILSAFE_APPEND'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 685                self.cmdline_failsafe
 686            )
 687
 688        sysconfig_bootloader_location = ''.join(
 689            [self.root_dir, '/etc/sysconfig/']
 690        )
 691        if os.path.exists(sysconfig_bootloader_location):
 692            log.info('Writing sysconfig bootloader file')
 693            sysconfig_bootloader_file = ''.join(
 694                [sysconfig_bootloader_location, 'bootloader']
 695            )
 696            sysconfig_bootloader = SysConfig(
 697                sysconfig_bootloader_file
 698            )
 699            sysconfig_bootloader_entries_sorted = OrderedDict(
 700                sorted(sysconfig_bootloader_entries.items())
 701            )
 702            for key, value in list(sysconfig_bootloader_entries_sorted.items()):
 703                log.info('--> {0}:{1}'.format(key, value))
 704                sysconfig_bootloader[key] = value
 705            sysconfig_bootloader.write()
 706
 707    def _setup_zipl2grub_conf(self):
 708        zipl2grub_config_file = ''.join(
 709            [self.root_dir, '/etc/default/zipl2grub.conf.in']
 710        )
 711        zipl2grub_config_file_orig = ''.join(
 712            [self.root_dir, '/etc/default/zipl2grub.conf.in.orig']
 713        )
 714        target_type = self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_targettype()
 715        target_blocksize = self.xml_state.build_type.get_target_blocksize()
 716        if target_type and os.path.exists(zipl2grub_config_file):
 717            if os.path.exists(zipl2grub_config_file_orig):
 718                # reset the original template file first
 719                shutil.copy2(zipl2grub_config_file_orig, zipl2grub_config_file)
 720            else:
 721                # no copy of the original template, create it
 722                shutil.copy2(zipl2grub_config_file, zipl2grub_config_file_orig)
 723            with open(zipl2grub_config_file) as zipl_config_file:
 724                zipl_config = zipl_config_file.read()
 725                zipl_config = re.sub(
 726                    r'(:menu)',
 727                    ':menu\n'
 728                    '    targettype = {0}\n'
 729                    '    targetbase = {1}\n'
 730                    '    targetblocksize = {2}\n'
 731                    '    targetoffset = {3}\n'
 732                    '    {4}'.format(
 733                        target_type if target_type != 'GPT' else 'SCSI',
 734                        self.custom_args['targetbase'],
 735                        target_blocksize or 512,
 736                        self._get_partition_start(
 737                            self.custom_args['targetbase']
 738                        ),
 739                        self._get_disk_geometry(
 740                            self.custom_args['targetbase']
 741                        )
 742                    ),
 743                    zipl_config
 744                )
 745            log.debug('Updated zipl template as follows')
 746            with open(zipl2grub_config_file, 'w') as zipl_config_file:
 747                log.debug(zipl_config)
 748                zipl_config_file.write(zipl_config)
 749
 750    def _setup_default_grub(self):
 751        """
 752        Create or update etc/default/grub by parameters required
 753        according to the root filesystem setup
 754
 755        * GRUB_DEFAULT
 756        * GRUB_TIMEOUT
 757        * GRUB_TIMEOUT_STYLE
 758        * SUSE_BTRFS_SNAPSHOT_BOOTING
 759        * SUSE_REMOVE_LINUX_ROOT_PARAM
 760        * GRUB_BACKGROUND
 761        * GRUB_THEME
 762        * GRUB_SERIAL_COMMAND
 763        * GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX
 764        * GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT
 765        * GRUB_GFXMODE
 766        * GRUB_TERMINAL_INPUT
 767        * GRUB_TERMINAL_OUTPUT
 768        * GRUB_DISTRIBUTOR
 769        * GRUB_DISABLE_LINUX_UUID
 770        * GRUB_DISABLE_LINUX_PARTUUID
 771        * GRUB_ENABLE_LINUX_LABEL
 772        """
 773        # elements to set only if not already in etc/default/grub
 774        grub_default_if_not_set_entries = {
 775            'GRUB_DEFAULT': 'saved'
 776        }
 777        # elements to set in any case
 778        grub_default_entries = {
 779            'GRUB_TIMEOUT': self.timeout,
 780            'GRUB_GFXMODE': self.gfxmode
 781        }
 782        if self.terminal_input:
 783            grub_default_entries['GRUB_TERMINAL_INPUT'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 784                self.terminal_input
 785            )
 786        if self.terminal_output:
 787            grub_default_entries['GRUB_TERMINAL_OUTPUT'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 788                self.terminal_output
 789            )
 790        grub_final_cmdline = re.sub(
 791            r'(^root=[^\s]+)|( root=[^\s]+)', '', self.cmdline
 792        ).strip()
 793        if self.persistency_type == 'by-label':
 794            label = re.search(r'(^root=[^\s]+)|( root=[^\s]+)', self.cmdline)
 795            if label:
 796                for match in label.groups():
 797                    if match and 'LABEL' in match:
 798                        grub_default_entries['GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX'] = \
 799                            '"{0}"'.format(match.strip())
 800                        grub_default_entries['SUSE_REMOVE_LINUX_ROOT_PARAM'] = \
 801                            'true'
 802            grub_default_entries['GRUB_ENABLE_LINUX_LABEL'] = 'true'
 803            grub_default_entries['GRUB_DISABLE_LINUX_UUID'] = 'true'
 804        elif self.persistency_type == 'by-partuuid':
 805            grub_default_entries['GRUB_DISABLE_LINUX_UUID'] = 'true'
 806            grub_default_entries['GRUB_DISABLE_LINUX_PARTUUID'] = 'false'
 807        if self.displayname:
 808            grub_default_entries['GRUB_DISTRIBUTOR'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 809                self.displayname
 810            )
 811        if self.timeout_style:
 812            grub_default_entries['GRUB_TIMEOUT_STYLE'] = self.timeout_style
 813        if grub_final_cmdline:
 814            grub_default_entries['GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 815                grub_final_cmdline
 816            )
 817        if self.serial_line_setup and \
 818           ('serial' in self.terminal_input or 'serial' in self.terminal_output):
 819            grub_default_entries['GRUB_SERIAL_COMMAND'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 820                self.serial_line_setup
 821            )
 822        if self.theme:
 823            theme_setup = '{0}/{1}/theme.txt'
 824            grub_default_entries['GRUB_THEME'] = theme_setup.format(
 825                ''.join(['/boot/', self.boot_directory_name, '/themes']),
 826                self.theme
 827            )
 828            theme_background = '{0}/{1}/background.png'.format(
 829                ''.join(['/boot/', self.boot_directory_name, '/themes']),
 830                self.theme
 831            )
 832            if os.path.exists(os.sep.join([self.root_dir, theme_background])):
 833                grub_default_entries['GRUB_BACKGROUND'] = theme_background
 834        if self.xml_state.build_type.get_btrfs_root_is_snapper_snapshot():
 835            grub_default_entries['SUSE_BTRFS_SNAPSHOT_BOOTING'] = 'true'
 836        if self.custom_args.get('crypto_disk'):
 837            grub_default_entries['GRUB_ENABLE_CRYPTODISK'] = 'y'
 838
 839        enable_blscfg_implemented = Command.run(
 840            [
 841                'grep', '-q', 'GRUB_ENABLE_BLSCFG',
 842                self._get_grub2_mkconfig_tool()
 843            ], raise_on_error=False
 844        )
 845        if self.bls and enable_blscfg_implemented.returncode == 0:
 846            grub_default_entries['GRUB_ENABLE_BLSCFG'] = 'true'
 847
 848        if self.arch.startswith('s390') and self.host_key_certificates:
 849            # At the moment no generic enabler for secure execution
 850            # on s390 exists in grub upstream. Thus the following
 851            # variable setup is distribution specific:
 852            # Enable Secure Execution: SUSE specific variables
 853            host_key_list = []
 854            signing_key_list = []
 855            revocation_key_list = []
 856            grub_default_entries['SUSE_S390_SE_ENABLE'] = 'true'
 857            grub_default_entries['SUSE_S390_SE_CA_CERT'] = \
 858                self.host_key_certificates[0]['hkd_ca_cert']
 859            for host_key_certificate in self.host_key_certificates:
 860                signing_key_list.append(host_key_certificate['hkd_sign_cert'])
 861                host_key_list += host_key_certificate['hkd_cert']
 862                if host_key_certificate.get('hkd_revocation_list'):
 863                    revocation_key_list += \
 864                        host_key_certificate['hkd_revocation_list']
 865            grub_default_entries['SUSE_S390_SE_HOST_KEY'] = \
 866                ','.join(host_key_list)
 867            grub_default_entries['SUSE_S390_SE_HOST_KEY_SIGNING_KEY'] = \
 868                ','.join(signing_key_list)
 869            if revocation_key_list:
 870                grub_default_entries['SUSE_S390_SE_REVOCATION_LIST'] = \
 871                    ','.join(revocation_key_list)
 872
 873        if grub_default_entries:
 874            log.info('Writing grub2 defaults file')
 875            grub_default_location = ''.join([self.root_dir, '/etc/default/'])
 876            if os.path.exists(grub_default_location):
 877                grub_default_file = ''.join([grub_default_location, 'grub'])
 878                grub_default = SysConfig(grub_default_file)
 879                grub_default_entries_sorted = OrderedDict(
 880                    sorted(grub_default_entries.items())
 881                )
 882                for key, value in list(grub_default_entries_sorted.items()):
 883                    log.info('--> {0}:{1}'.format(key, value))
 884                    grub_default[key] = value
 885                grub_default_if_not_set_entries_sorted = OrderedDict(
 886                    sorted(grub_default_if_not_set_entries.items())
 887                )
 888                for key, value in list(grub_default_if_not_set_entries_sorted.items()):
 889                    if not grub_default.get(key):
 890                        log.info('--> {0}:{1}'.format(key, value))
 891                        grub_default[key] = value
 892                grub_default.write()
 893
 894    def _setup_secure_boot_efi_image(
 895        self, lookup_path, uuid=None, efi_uuid=None,
 896        mbrid=None, target_type='disk'
 897    ):
 898        """
 899        Provide the shim loader and the shim signed grub2 loader
 900        in the required boot path. Normally this task is done by
 901        the shim-install tool. However, shim-install does not exist
 902        on all distributions and the script does not operate well
 903        in e.g CD environments from which we generate live and/or
 904        install media. Thus shim-install is used if possible at
 905        install time of the bootloader because it requires access
 906        to the target block device. In any other case this setup
 907        code should act as the fallback solution
 908        """
 909        log.warning(
 910            'Running fallback setup for shim secure boot efi image'
 911        )
 912        if not lookup_path:
 913            lookup_path = self.boot_dir
 914        grub_images = Defaults.get_signed_grub_loader(lookup_path, target_type)
 915        shim_images = Defaults.get_shim_loader(lookup_path)
 916        if not grub_images:
 917            raise KiwiBootLoaderGrubSecureBootError(
 918                'Signed grub2 efi loader not found'
 919            )
 920        # The shim concept is based on a two step system including a
 921        # grub image(shim) that got signed by Microsoft followed by
 922        # a grub image that got signed by the shim. The shim image
 923        # is the one that gets loaded by the firmware which itself
 924        # loads the second stage grub image
 925        for grub_image in grub_images:
 926            if grub_image.binaryname:
 927                if shim_images:
 928                    target_grub_image_name = os.sep.join(
 929                        [self.efi_boot_path, grub_image.binaryname]
 930                    )
 931                else:
 932                    # Without shim a self signed grub image is used that
 933                    # gets loaded by the firmware
 934                    target_grub_image_name = os.sep.join(
 935                        [self.efi_boot_path, grub_image.targetname]
 936                    )
 937                if not os.path.isfile(target_grub_image_name):
 938                    log.info(
 939                        f'--> Using grub image: {grub_image.filename}'
 940                    )
 941                    Command.run(
 942                        ['cp', grub_image.filename, target_grub_image_name]
 943                    )
 944        for shim_image in shim_images:
 945            if shim_image.filename:
 946                target_efi_image_name = os.sep.join(
 947                    [self.efi_boot_path, shim_image.binaryname]
 948                )
 949                if not os.path.isfile(target_efi_image_name):
 950                    log.info(
 951                        f'--> Using shim image: {shim_image.filename}'
 952                    )
 953                    Command.run(
 954                        ['cp', shim_image.filename, target_efi_image_name]
 955                    )
 956        # mok manager
 957        mok_managers = Defaults.get_mok_manager(lookup_path)
 958        if mok_managers and shim_images:
 959            for mok_manager in mok_managers:
 960                target_mok_manager = os.sep.join(
 961                    [self.efi_boot_path, os.path.basename(mok_manager)]
 962                )
 963                if not os.path.isfile(target_mok_manager):
 964                    log.info(
 965                        f'--> Using mok image: {mok_manager}'
 966                    )
 967                    Command.run(
 968                        ['cp', mok_manager, self.efi_boot_path]
 969                    )
 970        self._create_efi_config_search(uuid, efi_uuid, mbrid)
 971
 972    def _setup_efi_image(
 973        self, uuid=None, efi_uuid=None, mbrid=None,
 974        lookup_path=None, target_type='disk'
 975    ):
 976        """
 977        Provide the unsigned grub2 efi image in the required boot path
 978        If a prebuilt efi image as provided by the distribution could
 979        be found, this image will be used. If no such image could be
 980        found we create a custom image with a pre defined set of
 981        grub modules
 982        """
 983        if not lookup_path:
 984            lookup_path = self.boot_dir
 985        grub_images = Defaults.get_unsigned_grub_loader(
 986            lookup_path, target_type
 987        )
 988        can_write = self.xml_state.build_type.get_overlayroot_write_partition()
 989        if grub_images and can_write is not False:
 990            for grub_image in grub_images:
 991                log.info(f'--> Using prebuilt unsigned efi image: {grub_image}')
 992                target_grub_image_name = os.sep.join(
 993                    [self.efi_boot_path, grub_image.targetname]
 994                )
 995                Command.run(
 996                    ['cp', grub_image.filename, target_grub_image_name]
 997                )
 998            self._create_efi_config_search(uuid, efi_uuid, mbrid)
 999        else:
1000            log.info('--> Creating unsigned efi image')
1001            self._create_efi_image(
1002                uuid, efi_uuid, mbrid, lookup_path
1003            )
1004
1005    def _setup_chrp_config(self, mbrid):
1006        early_boot_script = os.path.normpath(
1007            os.sep.join(
1008                [self._get_grub2_boot_path(), 'powerpc-ieee1275', 'grub.cfg']
1009            )
1010        )
1011        self._create_early_boot_script_for_mbrid_search(
1012            early_boot_script, mbrid
1013        )
1014        chrp_dir = os.path.normpath(os.sep.join([self.boot_dir, 'ppc']))
1015        Path.create(chrp_dir)
1016        chrp_bootinfo_file = os.sep.join([chrp_dir, 'bootinfo.txt'])
1017        chrp_config = dedent('''
1018            <chrp-boot>
1019            <description>{os_name}</description>
1020            <os-name>{os_name}</os-name>
1021            <boot-script>boot &device;:1,\\boot\\grub2\\powerpc-ieee1275\\{chrp_loader}</boot-script>
1022            </chrp-boot>
1023        ''').strip() + os.linesep
1024        with open(chrp_bootinfo_file, 'w') as chrp_bootinfo:
1025            chrp_bootinfo.write(
1026                chrp_config.format(
1027                    os_name=self.get_menu_entry_install_title(),
1028                    chrp_loader=Defaults.get_grub_chrp_loader(self.boot_dir)
1029                )
1030            )
1031
1032    def _setup_platform_image(self, mbrid, lookup_path=None):
1033        """
1034        Provide bios grub image
1035        """
1036        if not lookup_path:
1037            lookup_path = self.boot_dir
1038        grub_image = Defaults.get_grub_platform_core_loader(lookup_path)
1039        if grub_image:
1040            log.info(f'--> Using prebuilt bios image: {grub_image}')
1041        else:
1042            log.info('--> Creating bios image')
1043            self._create_platform_image(
1044                mbrid, lookup_path
1045            )
1046        if Defaults.is_ppc64_arch(Defaults.get_platform_name()):
1047            self._setup_chrp_config(mbrid)
1048            return
1049        bash_command = ' '.join(
1050            [
1051                'cat',
1052                self._get_grub_platform_modules_path(
1053                    lookup_path
1054                ) + '/cdboot.img',
1055                grub_image or self._get_grub_platform_image_name(lookup_path),
1056                '>',
1057                os.sep.join(
1058                    [
1059                        self._get_grub_platform_modules_path(lookup_path),
1060                        Defaults.get_iso_grub_loader()
1061                    ]
1062                )
1063            ]
1064        )
1065        Command.run(
1066            ['bash', '-c', bash_command]
1067        )
1068
1069    def _create_embedded_fat_efi_image(self, path):
1070        """
1071        Creates a EFI system partition image at the given path.
1072        Must be called after setup_install_boot_images and write.
1073        """
1074        fat_image_mbsize = int(
1075            self.xml_state.build_type
1076                .get_efifatimagesize() or defaults.EFI_FAT_IMAGE_SIZE
1077        )
1078        efi_folder = Temporary(prefix='efi_folder').new_dir()
1079        efi_data = DataSync(self.boot_dir + '/EFI/', efi_folder.name)
1080        efi_data.sync_data(
1081            options=Defaults.get_sync_options(),
1082            exclude=Defaults.get_exclude_list_from_custom_exclude_files_for_efifatimage(self.root_dir)
1083        )
1084        Command.run(
1085            ['qemu-img', 'create', path, f'{fat_image_mbsize}M']
1086        )
1087        Command.run(
1088            ['mkdosfs', '-n', 'BOOT', path]
1089        )
1090        Command.run(
1091            [
1092                'mcopy', '-Do', '-s', '-i', path,
1093                efi_folder.name, '::EFI'
1094            ]
1095        )
1096
1097    def _create_efi_image(
1098        self, uuid=None, efi_uuid=None, mbrid=None, lookup_path=None
1099    ):
1100        dracut_setup = self.xml_state.get_dracut_config('setup')
1101        early_boot_script = os.path.normpath(
1102            os.sep.join([self.efi_boot_path, 'earlyboot.cfg'])
1103        )
1104        self.early_boot_script_efi = early_boot_script
1105        if dracut_setup.uefi and efi_uuid:
1106            self._create_early_boot_script_for_uki_chainload(
1107                early_boot_script, efi_uuid
1108            )
1109        elif uuid:
1110            self._create_early_boot_script_for_uuid_search(
1111                early_boot_script, uuid
1112            )
1113        else:
1114            self._create_early_boot_script_for_mbrid_search(
1115                early_boot_script, mbrid
1116            )
1117        root_efi_path = '/boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/'
1118        root_efi_image = root_efi_path + Defaults.get_efi_image_name(self.arch)
1119
1120        Path.create(self.root_dir + root_efi_path)
1121
1122        module_list = Defaults.get_grub_efi_modules(multiboot=self.xen_guest)
1123        module_path = self._get_efi_modules_path(self.root_dir)
1124        if os.path.exists(module_path + '/linuxefi.mod'):
1125            module_list.append('linuxefi')
1126
1127        early_boot_script_on_media = \
1128            self.root_dir + root_efi_path + 'earlyboot.cfg'
1129        if early_boot_script != early_boot_script_on_media:
1130            log.debug(
1131                f'Copy earlyboot to media path: {early_boot_script_on_media}'
1132            )
1133            shutil.copy2(
1134                early_boot_script, early_boot_script_on_media
1135            )
1136        mkimage_call = Command.run(
1137            [
1138                'chroot', self.root_dir,
1139                os.path.basename(
1140                    self._get_grub2_mkimage_tool()
1141                ) or 'grub2-mkimage',
1142                '-O', Defaults.get_efi_module_directory_name(self.arch),
1143                '-o', root_efi_image,
1144                '-c', root_efi_path + 'earlyboot.cfg',
1145                '-p', os.path.join(self.get_boot_path(), self.boot_directory_name),
1146                '-d', module_path.replace(self.root_dir, '')
1147            ] + module_list
1148        )
1149        log.debug(mkimage_call.output)
1150
1151        # Copy generated EFI image to the media directory if this
1152        # is different from the system root directory, e.g the case
1153        # for live image builds or when using a custom kiwi initrd
1154        efi_image_root_file = self.root_dir + root_efi_image
1155        efi_image_media_file = os.sep.join(
1156            [self.efi_boot_path, os.path.basename(efi_image_root_file)]
1157        )
1158        if (efi_image_root_file != efi_image_media_file):
1159            log.debug(
1160                f'Copy grub image to media path: {efi_image_media_file}'
1161            )
1162            Path.create(os.path.dirname(efi_image_media_file))
1163            shutil.copy2(efi_image_root_file, efi_image_media_file)
1164
1165    def _create_efi_config_search(self, uuid=None, efi_uuid=None, mbrid=None):
1166        dracut_setup = self.xml_state.get_dracut_config('setup')
1167        efi_boot_config = self.efi_boot_path + '/grub.cfg'
1168        self.early_boot_script_efi = efi_boot_config
1169        if dracut_setup.uefi and efi_uuid:
1170            self._create_early_boot_script_for_uki_chainload(
1171                efi_boot_config, efi_uuid
1172            )
1173        elif uuid:
1174            self._create_early_boot_script_for_uuid_search(
1175                efi_boot_config, uuid
1176            )
1177        else:
1178            self._create_early_boot_script_for_mbrid_search(
1179                efi_boot_config, mbrid
1180            )
1181
1182    def _create_platform_image(self, mbrid, lookup_path=None):
1183        early_boot_script = os.path.normpath(
1184            os.sep.join([self._get_grub2_boot_path(), 'earlyboot.cfg'])
1185        )
1186        self._create_early_boot_script_for_mbrid_search(
1187            early_boot_script, mbrid
1188        )
1189        early_boot_script_on_media = os.sep.join(
1190            [self.root_dir, 'boot', self.boot_directory_name, 'earlyboot.cfg']
1191        )
1192        if early_boot_script != early_boot_script_on_media:
1193            log.debug(
1194                f'Copy earlyboot to media path: {early_boot_script_on_media}'
1195            )
1196            Path.create(
1197                os.path.dirname(early_boot_script_on_media)
1198            )
1199            shutil.copy2(
1200                early_boot_script, early_boot_script_on_media
1201            )
1202        mkimage_call = Command.run(
1203            [
1204                'chroot', self.root_dir,
1205                os.path.basename(
1206                    self._get_grub2_mkimage_tool()
1207                ) or 'grub2-mkimage',
1208                '-O', Defaults.get_grub_platform_module_directory_name(),
1209                '-o', self._get_grub_platform_image_name(self.root_dir).replace(
1210                    self.root_dir, ''
1211                ),
1212                '-c', early_boot_script.replace(self.boot_dir, ''),
1213                '-p', os.sep.join(
1214                    [self.get_boot_path(), self.boot_directory_name]
1215                ),
1216                '-d', self._get_grub_platform_modules_path(
1217                    self.root_dir
1218                ).replace(self.root_dir, '')
1219            ] + Defaults.get_grub_platform_modules(multiboot=self.xen_guest)
1220        )
1221        log.debug(mkimage_call.output)
1222
1223        # Copy generated EFI image to the media directory if this
1224        # is different from the system root directory, e.g the case
1225        # for live image builds or when using a custom kiwi initrd
1226        bios_image_root_file = self._get_grub_platform_image_name(self.root_dir)
1227        bios_image_media_file = bios_image_root_file.replace(
1228            self.root_dir, lookup_path
1229        )
1230        if (bios_image_root_file != bios_image_media_file):
1231            log.debug(
1232                f'Copy grub image to media path: {bios_image_media_file}'
1233            )
1234            Path.create(os.path.dirname(bios_image_media_file))
1235            shutil.copy2(bios_image_root_file, bios_image_media_file)
1236
1237    def _create_early_boot_script_for_uki_chainload(self, filename, uuid):
1238        with open(filename, 'w') as early_boot:
1239            early_boot.write(
1240                f'search --no-floppy --set=root --fs-uuid {uuid}{os.linesep}'
1241            )
1242            early_boot.write(
1243                f'chainloader ($root)/EFI/Linux/kiwi.efi{os.linesep}'
1244            )
1245            early_boot.write(f'boot{os.linesep}')
1246
1247    def _create_early_boot_script_for_uuid_search(self, filename, uuid):
1248        with open(filename, 'w') as early_boot:
1249            if self._has_btrfs_relative_path():
1250                early_boot.write(
1251                    'set btrfs_relative_path="yes"{0}'.format(os.linesep)
1252                )
1253            if self.custom_args.get('boot_is_crypto'):
1254                early_boot.write(
1255                    'insmod cryptodisk{0}'.format(os.linesep)
1256                )
1257                early_boot.write(
1258                    'insmod luks{0}'.format(os.linesep)
1259                )
1260                early_boot.write(
1261                    'cryptomount -u {0}{1}'.format(
1262                        uuid.replace('-', ''), os.linesep
1263                    )
1264                )
1265                early_boot.write(
1266                    'set root="cryptouuid/{0}"{1}'.format(
1267                        uuid.replace('-', ''), os.linesep
1268                    )
1269                )
1270            early_boot.write(
1271                'search --fs-uuid --set=root {0}{1}'.format(uuid, os.linesep)
1272            )
1273            early_boot.write(
1274                'set prefix=($root){0}{1}'.format(
1275                    os.path.join(self.get_boot_path(), self.boot_directory_name), os.linesep
1276                )
1277            )
1278            early_boot.write(
1279                '{0} ($root){1}/grub.cfg{2}'.format(self.grub_load, os.path.join(
1280                    self.get_boot_path(), self.boot_directory_name
1281                ), os.linesep)
1282            )
1283
1284    def _create_early_boot_script_for_mbrid_search(self, filename, mbrid):
1285        with open(filename, 'w') as early_boot:
1286            if self._has_btrfs_relative_path():
1287                early_boot.write(
1288                    'set btrfs_relative_path="yes"{0}'.format(os.linesep)
1289                )
1290            if mbrid:
1291                early_boot.write(
1292                    f'search --file --set=root /boot/{mbrid.get_id()}{os.linesep}'
1293                )
1294            else:
1295                # Fallback search for /boot/mbrid
1296                early_boot.write(
1297                    f'search --file --set=root /boot/mbrid{os.linesep}'
1298                )
1299            early_boot.write(
1300                'set prefix=($root)/boot/{0}{1}'.format(
1301                    self.boot_directory_name, os.linesep
1302                )
1303            )
1304            early_boot.write(
1305                '{0} ($root)/boot/{1}/grub.cfg{2}'.format(
1306                    self.grub_load, self.boot_directory_name, os.linesep
1307                )
1308            )

1310    def _get_grub2_mkimage_tool(self) -> str:
1311        grub_mkimage_file_path = ''
1312        for grub_mkimage_tool in ['grub2-mkimage', 'grub-mkimage']:
1313            grub_mkimage_file_path = Path.which(
1314                grub_mkimage_tool, root_dir=self.root_dir
1315            ) or ''
1316            if grub_mkimage_file_path:
1317                break
1318        return grub_mkimage_file_path
1319
1320    def _get_grub2_mkconfig_tool(self) -> str:
1321        grub_mkconfig_file_path = ''
1322        for grub_mkconfig_tool in ['grub2-mkconfig', 'grub-mkconfig']:
1323            grub_mkconfig_file_path = Path.which(
1324                grub_mkconfig_tool, root_dir=self.root_dir
1325            ) or ''
1326            if grub_mkconfig_file_path:
1327                break
1328        return grub_mkconfig_file_path
1329
1330    def _get_grub2_boot_path(self):
1331        return self.boot_dir + '/boot/' + self.boot_directory_name

1370    def _find_theme_background_file(self, lookup_path):
1371        background_pattern = os.sep.join(
1372            [
1373                lookup_path, 'boot', self.boot_directory_name, 'themes',
1374                '*', 'background.png'
1375            ]
1376        )
1377        for background_file in glob.iglob(background_pattern):
1378            return background_file
1379
1380    def _copy_theme_data_to_boot_directory(self, lookup_path, target):
1381        if not lookup_path:
1382            lookup_path = self.boot_dir
1383        font_name = 'unicode.pf2'
1384        efi_font_dir = Defaults.get_grub_efi_font_directory(
1385            lookup_path
1386        )
1387        boot_fonts_dir = os.path.normpath(
1388            os.sep.join(
1389                [
1390                    self.boot_dir,
1391                    self.get_boot_path(target),
1392                    self.boot_directory_name,
1393                    'fonts'
1394                ]
1395            )
1396        )
1397        try:
1398            unicode_font = Defaults.get_grub_path(
1399                lookup_path, font_name
1400            )
1401            if not os.path.exists(os.sep.join([boot_fonts_dir, font_name])):
1402                Path.create(boot_fonts_dir)
1403                Command.run(
1404                    ['cp', unicode_font, boot_fonts_dir]
1405                )
1406            if efi_font_dir:
1407                Command.run(
1408                    ['cp', unicode_font, efi_font_dir]
1409                )
1410        except Exception as issue:
1411            raise KiwiBootLoaderGrubFontError(
1412                'Setting up unicode font failed with {0}'.format(issue)
1413            )
1414
1415        boot_theme_dir = os.sep.join(
1416            [self.boot_dir, 'boot', self.boot_directory_name, 'themes']
1417        )
1418        Path.create(boot_theme_dir)
1419
1420        if self.theme:
1421            theme_dir = Defaults.get_grub_path(
1422                lookup_path, 'themes/' + self.theme, raise_on_error=False
1423            )
1424            boot_theme_background_file = self._find_theme_background_file(
1425                lookup_path
1426            )
1427            if theme_dir and os.path.exists(theme_dir):
1428                if boot_theme_background_file:
1429                    # A background file was found. Preserve a copy of the
1430                    # file which was created at install time of the theme
1431                    # package by the activate-theme script
1432                    boot_theme_background_backup_file = os.sep.join(
1433                        [self.boot_dir, 'background.png']
1434                    )
1435                    Command.run(
1436                        [
1437                            'cp', boot_theme_background_file,
1438                            boot_theme_background_backup_file
1439                        ]
1440                    )
1441                # sync theme data from install path to boot path
1442                data = DataSync(
1443                    theme_dir, boot_theme_dir
1444                )
1445                data.sync_data(
1446                    options=['-a']
1447                )
1448                if boot_theme_background_file:
1449                    # Install preserved background file to the theme
1450                    Command.run(
1451                        [
1452                            'mv', boot_theme_background_backup_file,
1453                            os.sep.join([boot_theme_dir, self.theme])
1454                        ]
1455                    )
1456            elif boot_theme_background_file:
1457                # assume all theme data is in the directory of the
1458                # background file and just sync that directory to the
1459                # boot path
1460                data = DataSync(
1461                    os.path.dirname(boot_theme_background_file), boot_theme_dir
1462                )
1463                data.sync_data(
1464                    options=['-a']
1465                )
1466
1467        self._check_boot_theme_exists()
1468
1469    def _check_boot_theme_exists(self):
1470        if self.theme:
1471            theme_dir = os.sep.join(
1472                [
1473                    self.boot_dir, 'boot', self.boot_directory_name,
1474                    'themes', self.theme
1475                ]
1476            )
1477            if not os.path.exists(theme_dir):
1478                log.warning('Theme %s not found', theme_dir)
1479                log.warning('Set bootloader terminal to console mode')
1480                self.terminal_input = 'console'
1481                self.terminal_output = 'console'
1482
1483    def _setup_EFI_path(self, lookup_path):
1484        """
1485        Copy efi boot data from lookup_path to the root directory
1486        """
1487        if not lookup_path:
1488            lookup_path = self.boot_dir
1489        efi_path = lookup_path + '/boot/efi/'
1490        if os.path.exists(efi_path):
1491            efi_data = DataSync(efi_path, self.boot_dir)
1492            efi_data.sync_data(options=['-a'])

1494    def _copy_efi_modules_to_boot_directory(self, lookup_path):

1496            self._get_efi_modules_path(lookup_path)

1500            efi32_module_path = self._get_efi_modules_path(
1501                lookup_path, 'i386', raise_on_error=False

1503            if os.path.exists(efi32_module_path):
1504                self._copy_modules_to_boot_directory_from(efi32_module_path)

1513            self._get_xen_modules_path(lookup_path)
1514        )

1516    def _copy_modules_to_boot_directory_from(self, module_path):
1517        boot_module_path = \
1518            self._get_grub2_boot_path() + '/' + os.path.basename(module_path)
1519        try:
1520            data = DataSync(
1521                module_path + '/', boot_module_path
1522            )
1523            data.sync_data(
1524                options=['-a'], exclude=['*.module']
1525            )
1526        except Exception as e:
1527            raise KiwiBootLoaderGrubModulesError(
1528                f'Module synchronisation failed with: {format(e)}'
1529            )

1531    def _get_shim_install(self):
1532        return Path.which(
1533            filename='shim-install', root_dir=self.boot_dir
1534        )

1536    def _fix_grub_root_device_reference(self, config_file, boot_options):
1537        if self.root_reference:
1538            # grub2-mkconfig has no idea how the correct root= setup is
1539            # for disk images created with overlayroot enabled or in a
1540            # buildservice worker environment. Because of that the mkconfig
1541            # tool just finds the raw partition loop device and includes it
1542            # which is wrong. In this particular case we have to patch the
1543            # written config file and replace the wrong root= reference with
1544            # the correct value.
1545            with open(config_file) as grub_config_file:
1546                grub_config = grub_config_file.read()
1547                # The following expression matches any of the following
1548                # grub mkconfig root= settings and replaces it with a
1549                # correct value
1550                # 1. root=LOCAL-KIWI-MAPPED-DEVICE
1551                # 2. root=[a-zA-Z]=ANY-LINUX-BY-ID-VALUE
1552                grub_config = re.sub(
1553                    r'(root=[a-zA-Z]+=[a-zA-Z0-9:\.-]+)|(root={0})'.format(
1554                        boot_options.get('root_device')
1555                    ),
1556                    '{0}'.format(self.root_reference),
1557                    grub_config
1558                )
1559
1560            try:
1561                with open(config_file, 'w') as grub_config_file:
1562                    grub_config_file.write(grub_config)
1563            except OSError as issue:
1564                log.warning(f'{func_name()} skipped: {issue}')
1565                return
1566
1567            if self.firmware.efi_mode():
1568                vendor_grubenv_file = \
1569                    Defaults.get_vendor_grubenv(self.efi_mount.mountpoint)
1570                if vendor_grubenv_file:
1571                    with open(vendor_grubenv_file) as vendor_grubenv:
1572                        grubenv = vendor_grubenv.read()
1573                        grubenv = grubenv.replace(
1574                            'root={0}'.format(
1575                                boot_options.get('root_device')
1576                            ),
1577                            self.root_reference
1578                        )
1579                    with open(vendor_grubenv_file, 'w') as vendor_grubenv:
1580                        vendor_grubenv.write(grubenv)
1581
1582    def _fix_grub_loader_entries_boot_cmdline(self):
1583        if self.cmdline:
1584            # For distributions that follows the bootloader spec here:
1585            # https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Specifications/BootLoaderSpec
1586            # the menu entries are managed in extra files written to
1587            # boot/loader/entries. The grub2-mkconfig tool imports the
1588            # information from there and has no own menu entries data
1589            # in grub.cfg anymore. Unfortunately the system that writes
1590            # those new boot/loader/entries has several issues. It produces
1591            # a complete mess when used in chroot environments. In such
1592            # an environment it takes the proc/cmdline data from the host
1593            # that built the image and completely ignores the setup of
1594            # the image description. Overall for image building the
1595            # tooling is completely broken and we are forced to patch the
1596            # entire cmdline for the menuentries on such systems.
1597            loader_entries_pattern = os.sep.join(
1598                [
1599                    self.root_mount.mountpoint,
1600                    'boot', 'loader', 'entries', '*.conf'
1601                ]
1602            )
1603            for menu_entry_file in glob.iglob(loader_entries_pattern):
1604                with open(menu_entry_file) as grub_menu_entry_file:
1605                    menu_entry = grub_menu_entry_file.read()
1606                    menu_entry = re.sub(
1607                        r'options (.*)',
1608                        r'options {0}'.format(self.cmdline),
1609                        menu_entry
1610                    )
1611                try:
1612                    with open(menu_entry_file, 'w') as grub_menu_entry_file:
1613                        grub_menu_entry_file.write(menu_entry)
1614                except OSError as issue:
1615                    log.warning(f'{func_name()} skipped: {issue}')
1616                    return
1617
1618    def _fix_grub_loader_entries_linux_and_initrd_paths(self):
1619        # For the same reasons encoded in _fix_grub_loader_entries_boot_cmdline
1620        # this method exists. In this method the wrong paths to the linux
1621        # kernel and initrd gets fixed
1622        loader_entries_pattern = os.sep.join(
1623            [
1624                self.root_mount.mountpoint,
1625                'boot', 'loader', 'entries', '*.conf'
1626            ]
1627        )
1628        for menu_entry_file in glob.iglob(loader_entries_pattern):
1629            with open(menu_entry_file) as grub_menu_entry_file:
1630                menu_entry = grub_menu_entry_file.read().split(os.linesep)
1631
1632            for line_number, menu_entry_line in enumerate(menu_entry):
1633                if bool(re.match(r'^(linux|initrd) .*', menu_entry_line)):
1634
1635                    log.debug(f'Existing loader entry: {menu_entry_line}')
1636                    config_path = menu_entry_line.split(' ', 1)[0]
1637
1638                    basename = os.path.basename(menu_entry_line)
1639                    if self.bootpartition:
1640                        config_path = (f'{config_path} /{basename}')
1641                    else:
1642                        config_path = (f'{config_path} /boot/{basename}')
1643
1644                    menu_entry[line_number] = config_path
1645                    log.debug(f'Updated loader entry: {config_path}')
1646
1647            menu_entry = os.linesep.join(menu_entry)
1648            try:
1649                with open(menu_entry_file, 'w') as grub_menu_entry_file:
1650                    grub_menu_entry_file.write(menu_entry)
1651            except OSError as issue:
1652                log.warning(f'{func_name()} skipped: {issue}')
1653
1654    def _get_partition_start(self, disk_device):
1655        if self.target_table_type == 'dasd':
1656            blocks = self._get_dasd_disk_geometry_element(
1657                disk_device, 'blocks per track'
1658            )
1659            bash_command = [
1660                'fdasd', '-f', '-s', '-p', disk_device,
1661                '|', 'grep', '"^ "',
1662                '|', 'head', '-n', '1',
1663                '|', 'tr', '-s', '" "'
1664            ]
1665            fdasd_call = Command.run(
1666                ['bash', '-c', ' '.join(bash_command)]
1667            )
1668            fdasd_output = fdasd_call.output
1669            try:
1670                start_track = int(fdasd_output.split(' ')[2].lstrip())
1671            except Exception:
1672                raise KiwiDiskGeometryError(
1673                    f'unknown partition format: {fdasd_output}'
1674                )
1675            return '{0}'.format(start_track * blocks)
1676        else:
1677            bash_command = ' '.join(
1678                [
1679                    'sfdisk', '--dump', disk_device,
1680                    '|', 'grep', '"1 :"',
1681                    '|', 'cut', '-f1', '-d,',
1682                    '|', 'cut', '-f2', '-d='
1683                ]
1684            )
1685            return Command.run(
1686                ['bash', '-c', bash_command]
1687            ).output.strip()
1688
1689    def _get_disk_geometry(self, disk_device):
1690        disk_geometry = ''
1691        if self.target_table_type == 'dasd':
1692            disk_geometry = 'targetgeometry = {0},{1},{2}'.format(
1693                self._get_dasd_disk_geometry_element(
1694                    disk_device, 'cylinders'
1695                ),
1696                self._get_dasd_disk_geometry_element(
1697                    disk_device, 'tracks per cylinder'
1698                ),
1699                self._get_dasd_disk_geometry_element(
1700                    disk_device, 'blocks per track'
1701                )
1702            )
1703        return disk_geometry
1704
1705    def _get_dasd_disk_geometry_element(self, disk_device, search):
1706        fdasd = ['fdasd', '-f', '-p', disk_device]
1707        bash_command = fdasd + ['|', 'grep', '"' + search + '"']
1708        fdasd_call = Command.run(
1709            ['bash', '-c', ' '.join(bash_command)]
1710        )
1711        fdasd_output = fdasd_call.output
1712        try:
1713            return int(fdasd_output.split(':')[1].lstrip())
1714        except Exception:
1715            raise KiwiDiskGeometryError(
1716                f'unknown format for disk geometry: {fdasd_output}'
1717            )
1718
1719    def _create_loopback_config(self, filename):
1720        with open(filename, 'w') as loopback_cfg:
1721            loopback_cfg.write(
1722                'source /boot/{0}/grub.cfg{1}'.format(
1723                    self.boot_directory_name, os.linesep
1724                )
1725            )
1726
1727    def _get_custom_template(self) -> str:
1728        if not self.xml_state.build_type.bootloader:
1729            return ''
1730        template_file = \
1731            self.xml_state.build_type.bootloader[0].get_grub_template()
1732        if not template_file:
1733            return ''
1734        template_path = os.path.join(
1735            os.path.abspath(
1736                self.xml_state.xml_data.description_dir
1737            ),
1738            self.xml_state.build_type.bootloader[0].get_grub_template()
1739        )
1740        if not os.path.exists(template_path):
1741            raise KiwiFileNotFound(
1742                f'failed to locate custom GRUB template {template_file}'
1743            )
1744        return template_path
1745
1746    def _has_btrfs_relative_path(self) -> bool:
1747        if self.xml_state.build_type.get_btrfs_set_default_volume() or \
1748           self.xml_state.build_type.get_btrfs_root_is_snapper_snapshot():
1749            return True
1750        return False
1751
1752    def _setup_loader_variables(self):
1753        """
1754        Run grub2-editenv for writing an updated environment blob
1755        """
1756        if self.root_mount:
1757            variable_list = \
1758                self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_environment_variables()
1759            if variable_list:
1760                log.info(f'Set grub environment variables: {variable_list}')
1761                Command.run(
1762                    [
1763                        'chroot', self.root_mount.mountpoint,
1764                        'grub2-editenv', '-', 'set'
1765                    ] + variable_list
1766                )

  68    def post_init(self, custom_args):
  69        """
  70        grub2 post initialization method
  71
  72        :param dict custom_args:
  73            Contains grub config arguments
  74
  75            .. code:: python
  76
  77                {'grub_directory_name': 'grub|grub2'}
  78        """
  79        self.host_key_certificates = self.xml_state.get_host_key_certificates()
  80        self.efi_csm = True if self.xml_state.build_type.get_eficsm() is None \
  81            else self.xml_state.build_type.get_eficsm()
  82        self.custom_args = custom_args
  83        self.config_options = []
  84        arch = Defaults.get_platform_name()
  85        if arch == 'x86_64':
  86            # grub2 support for bios and efi systems
  87            self.arch = arch
  88        elif arch == 'loongarch64':
  89            # grub2 support for efi systems
  90            self.arch = arch
  91        elif arch.startswith('ppc64'):
  92            # grub2 support for ofw and opal systems
  93            self.arch = arch
  94        elif arch == 'ix86':
  95            # grub2 support for bios systems
  96            self.arch = arch
  97        elif arch == 'aarch64' or arch.startswith('arm'):
  98            # grub2 support for efi systems
  99            self.arch = arch
 100        elif arch.startswith('s390'):
 101            # grub2 support for s390x systems
 102            self.arch = arch
 103        elif arch == 'riscv64':
 104            # grub2 support for efi systems
 105            self.arch = arch
 106        else:
 107            raise KiwiBootLoaderGrubPlatformError(
 108                f'host architecture {arch} not supported for grub2 setup'
 109            )
 110
 111        if self.custom_args and 'grub_directory_name' in self.custom_args:
 112            self.boot_directory_name = self.custom_args['grub_directory_name']
 113        else:
 114            self.boot_directory_name = 'grub'
 115
 116        if self.custom_args and 'grub_load_command' in self.custom_args:
 117            self.grub_load = self.custom_args['grub_load_command']
 118        else:
 119            self.grub_load = 'source'
 120
 121        if self.custom_args and 'config_options' in self.custom_args:
 122            self.config_options = self.custom_args['config_options']
 123
 124        # This default output terminal type will change to console
 125        # with the next major kiwi version update. Also see:
 126        # https://github.com/OSInside/kiwi/issues/2494
 127        self.terminal_output = \
 128            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_console()[0] or 'gfxterm'
 129
 130        self.terminal_input = \
 131            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_console()[1] or 'console'
 132
 133        self.gfxmode = self.get_gfxmode('grub2')
 134        self.theme = self.get_boot_theme()
 135        self.timeout = self.get_boot_timeout_seconds()
 136        self.bootpartition = self.xml_state.build_type.get_bootpartition()
 137        self.timeout_style = \
 138            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_timeout_style()
 139        self.displayname = self.xml_state.xml_data.get_displayname()
 140        self.bls = self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_bls()
 141        self.serial_line_setup = \
 142            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_serial_line_setup()
 143        self.continue_on_timeout = self.get_continue_on_timeout()
 144        self.failsafe_boot = self.failsafe_boot_entry_requested()
 145        self.mediacheck_boot = self.xml_state.build_type.get_mediacheck()
 146        self.xen_guest = self.xml_state.is_xen_guest()
 147        self.persistency_type = \
 148            self.xml_state.build_type.get_devicepersistency()
 149        self.firmware = FirmWare(
 150            self.xml_state
 151        )
 152        self.target_table_type = self.firmware.get_partition_table_type()
 153
 154        self.live_type = self.xml_state.build_type.get_flags()
 155        if not self.live_type:
 156            self.live_type = Defaults.get_default_live_iso_type()
 157
 158        self.volume_id = self.xml_state.build_type.get_volid() or \
 159            Defaults.get_volume_id()
 160        self.install_volid = self.xml_state.build_type.get_volid() or \
 161            Defaults.get_install_volume_id()
 162        self.use_disk_password = \
 163            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_use_disk_password()
 164
 165        self.live_boot_options = [
 166            'root=live:CDLABEL={0}'.format(self.volume_id),
 167            'rd.live.image'
 168        ]
 169        self.install_boot_options = [
 170            'loglevel=0'
 171        ]
 172        if self.xml_state.get_initrd_system() == 'dracut':
 173            self.install_boot_options.append(
 174                'root=install:CDLABEL={0}'.format(self.install_volid)
 175            )

 177            self.live_boot_options += \
 178                Defaults.get_live_iso_persistent_boot_options(
 179                    self.xml_state.build_type.get_hybridpersistent_filesystem()
 180                )
