 183            self.multiboot = True
 184        elif self.xen_guest:
 185            self.multiboot = False
 186        else:
 187            self.multiboot = False

 191        self.efi_boot_path = None

 198    def write(self):
 199        """
 200        Write bootloader configuration
 201
 202        * writes grub.cfg template by KIWI if template system is used
 203        * creates an embedded fat efi image for EFI ISO boot
 204        """
 205        if self.config:
 206            log.info('Writing KIWI template grub.cfg file')
 207            config_dir = self._get_grub2_boot_path()
 208            config_file = config_dir + '/grub.cfg'
 209            Path.create(config_dir)
 210            with open(config_file, 'w') as config:
 211                config.write(self.config)

 216    def write_meta_data(
 217        self, root_device=None, write_device=None, boot_options=''
 218    ):
 219        """
 220        Write bootloader setup meta data files
 221
 222        * cmdline arguments initialization
 223        * etc/default/grub setup file
 224        * etc/default/zipl2grub.conf.in (s390 only)
 225        * etc/sysconfig/bootloader
 226
 227        :param string root_device: root device node
 228        :param string write_device: overlay root write device node
 229        :param string boot_options: kernel options as string
 230        :param bool iso_boot: indicate target is an ISO
 231        """
 232        self.cmdline = ' '.join(
 233            [self.get_boot_cmdline(root_device, write_device), boot_options]
 234        )
 235        self.cmdline_failsafe = ' '.join(
 236            [self.cmdline, Defaults.get_failsafe_kernel_options(), boot_options]
 237        )
 238        self.root_reference = self._get_root_cmdline_parameter(
 239            root_device
 240        )
 241
 242        self._setup_default_grub()
 243        self._setup_sysconfig_bootloader()
 244        if self.arch.startswith('s390'):
 245            self._setup_zipl2grub_conf()

 247    def setup_disk_image_config(
 248        self, boot_uuid=None, root_uuid=None, hypervisor=None,
 249        kernel=None, initrd=None, boot_options={}
 250    ):
 251        """
 252        Create grub2 config file to boot from disk using grub2-mkconfig
 253
 254        :param string boot_uuid: unused
 255        :param string root_uuid: unused
 256        :param string hypervisor: unused
 257        :param string kernel: unused
 258        :param string initrd: unused
 259        :param dict boot_options:
 260
 261        options dictionary that has to contain the root and boot
 262        device and optional volume configuration. KIWI has to
 263        mount the system prior to run grub2-mkconfig.
 264
 265        .. code:: python
 266
 267            {
 268                'root_device': string,
 269                'boot_device': string,
 270                'efi_device': string,
 271                'system_volumes':
 272                    volume_manager_instance.get_volumes(),
 273                'system_root_volume':
 274                    volume_manager_instance.get_root_volume_name()
 275            }
 276        """
 277        self._mount_system(
 278            boot_options.get('root_device'),
 279            boot_options.get('boot_device'),
 280            boot_options.get('efi_device'),
 281            boot_options.get('system_volumes'),
 282            boot_options.get('system_root_volume')
 283        )
 284        config_file = os.sep.join(
 285            [
 286                self.root_mount.mountpoint, 'boot',
 287                self.boot_directory_name, 'grub.cfg'
 288            ]
 289        )
 290        # Setup/Update loader environment
 291        self._setup_loader_variables()
 292
 293        # Disable os-prober, it takes information from the host it
 294        # runs on which is not necessarily matching with the image
 295        os.environ.update({'GRUB_DISABLE_OS_PROBER': 'true'})
 296        Command.run(
 297            [
 298                'chroot', self.root_mount.mountpoint,
 299                os.path.basename(self._get_grub2_mkconfig_tool()), '-o',
 300                config_file.replace(self.root_mount.mountpoint, '')
 301            ], os.environ
 302        )
 303        if boot_options.get('root_device') != boot_options.get('boot_device'):
 304            # Create a boot -> . link on the boot partition.
 305            # The link is useful if the grub mkconfig command
 306            # references all boot files from /boot/... even if
 307            # an extra boot partition should cause it to read the
 308            # data from the toplevel
 309            bash_command = [
 310                'cd', os.sep.join([self.root_mount.mountpoint, 'boot']), '&&',
 311                'rm', '-f', 'boot', '&&',
 312                'ln', '-s', '.', 'boot'
 313            ]
 314            # not every filesystem supports symlinks, and the link is optional
 315            # therefore don't fail in case the link cannot be created
 316            Command.run(
 317                ['bash', '-c', ' '.join(bash_command)], raise_on_error=False
 318            )
 319
 320        # Create UKI image if requested
 321        dracut_setup = self.xml_state.get_dracut_config('setup')
 322        if dracut_setup.uefi:
 323            boot_image = boot_options.get('boot_image')
 324            if boot_image:
 325                efi_uki_path = \
 326                    f'{self.root_mount.mountpoint}/boot/efi/EFI/Linux/'
 327                Path.create(efi_uki_path)
 328                uki_image = boot_image.create_uki(self.cmdline)
 329                Command.run(
 330                    ['mv', uki_image, efi_uki_path]
 331                )
 332
 333        # Patch the written grub config file to actually work:
 334        # Unfortunately the grub tooling has several bugs and issues
 335        # which prevents it to work in image build environments.
 336        # More details can be found in the individual methods.
 337        # One fine day the following fix methods can hopefully
 338        # be deleted...
 339        self._fix_grub_root_device_reference(config_file, boot_options)
 340        self._fix_grub_loader_entries_boot_cmdline()
 341        self._fix_grub_loader_entries_linux_and_initrd_paths()
 342
 343        if self.firmware.efi_mode() and self.early_boot_script_efi:
 344            self._copy_grub_config_to_efi_path(
 345                self.efi_mount.mountpoint, self.early_boot_script_efi
 346            )
 347        self._umount_system()
 348
 349    def setup_install_image_config(
 350        self, mbrid, hypervisor='xen.gz', kernel='linux', initrd='initrd'
 351    ):
 352        """
 353        Create grub2 config file to boot from an ISO install image
 354
 355        :param string mbrid: mbrid file name on boot device
 356        :param string hypervisor: hypervisor name
 357        :param string kernel: kernel name
 358        :param string initrd: initrd name
 359        """
 360        log.info('Creating grub2 install config file from template')
 361        self.iso_boot = True
 362        has_graphics = False
 363        has_serial = False
 364        if 'gfxterm' in self.terminal_output:
 365            has_graphics = True
 366        if 'serial' in self.terminal_output or 'serial' in self.terminal_input:
 367            has_serial = True
 368        parameters = {
 369            'search_params': '--file --set=root /boot/' + mbrid.get_id(),
 370            'default_boot': self.get_install_image_boot_default(),
 371            'kernel_file': kernel,
 372            'initrd_file': initrd,
 373            'boot_options': ' '.join(
 374                [self.cmdline] + self.install_boot_options
 375            ),
 376            'failsafe_boot_options': ' '.join(
 377                [self.cmdline_failsafe] + self.install_boot_options
 378            ),
 379            'gfxmode': self.gfxmode,
 380            'theme': self.theme,
 381            'boot_timeout': self.timeout,
 382            'boot_timeout_style': self.timeout_style or 'menu',
 383            'serial_line_setup': self.serial_line_setup or '',
 384            'title': self.get_menu_entry_install_title(),
 385            'bootpath': self.get_boot_path('iso'),
 386            'boot_directory_name': self.boot_directory_name,
 387            'efi_image_name': Defaults.get_efi_image_name(self.arch),
 388            'terminal_input': self.terminal_input,
 389            'terminal_output': self.terminal_output
 390        }
 391        custom_template_path = self._get_custom_template()
 392        if custom_template_path:
 393            log.info('--> Using custom boot template')
 394            with open(custom_template_path) as custom_template_file:
 395                template = Template(custom_template_file.read())
 396        elif self.multiboot:
 397            log.info('--> Using multiboot install template')
 398            parameters['hypervisor'] = hypervisor
 399            template = self.grub2.get_multiboot_install_template(
 400                self.failsafe_boot, has_graphics, has_serial,
 401                self.continue_on_timeout, self._has_btrfs_relative_path()
 402            )
 403        else:
 404            log.info('--> Using standard boot install template')
 405            template = self.grub2.get_install_template(
 406                self.failsafe_boot, has_graphics, has_serial,
 407                self.continue_on_timeout, self._has_btrfs_relative_path()
 408            )
 409        try:
 410            self.config = template.substitute(parameters)
 411        except Exception as e:
 412            raise KiwiTemplateError(
 413                f'{type(e).__name__}: {format(e)}'
 414            )
 415        if self.firmware.efi_mode() and self.early_boot_script_efi:
 416            self._copy_grub_config_to_efi_path(
 417                self.boot_dir, self.early_boot_script_efi, 'iso'
 418            )
 419
 420    def setup_live_image_config(
 421        self, mbrid: SystemIdentifier, hypervisor='xen.gz', kernel='linux', initrd='initrd'
 422    ):
 423        """
 424        Create grub2 config file to boot a live media ISO image
 425
 426        :param string mbrid: mbrid file name on boot device
 427        :param string hypervisor: hypervisor name
 428        :param string kernel: kernel name
 429        :param string initrd: initrd name
 430        """
 431        log.info('Creating grub2 live ISO config file from template')
 432        self.iso_boot = True
 433        has_graphics = False
 434        has_serial = False
 435        if 'gfxterm' in self.terminal_output:
 436            has_graphics = True
 437        if 'serial' in self.terminal_output or 'serial' in self.terminal_input:
 438            has_serial = True
 439        parameters = {
 440            'search_params': '--file --set=root /boot/' + mbrid.get_id(),
 441            'default_boot': '0',
 442            'kernel_file': kernel,
 443            'initrd_file': initrd,
 444            'boot_options': ' '.join(
 445                [self.cmdline] + self.live_boot_options
 446            ),
 447            'failsafe_boot_options': ' '.join(
 448                [self.cmdline_failsafe] + self.live_boot_options
 449            ),
 450            'gfxmode': self.gfxmode,
 451            'theme': self.theme,
 452            'boot_timeout': self.timeout,
 453            'boot_timeout_style': self.timeout_style or 'menu',
 454            'serial_line_setup': self.serial_line_setup or '',
 455            'title': self.get_menu_entry_title(plain=True),
 456            'bootpath': self.get_boot_path('iso'),
 457            'boot_directory_name': self.boot_directory_name,
 458            'efi_image_name': Defaults.get_efi_image_name(self.arch),
 459            'terminal_input': self.terminal_input,
 460            'terminal_output': self.terminal_output
 461        }
 462        custom_template_path = self._get_custom_template()
 463        if custom_template_path:
 464            log.info('--> Using custom boot template')
 465            with open(custom_template_path) as custom_template_file:
 466                template = Template(custom_template_file.read())
 467        elif self.multiboot:
 468            log.info('--> Using multiboot template')
 469            parameters['hypervisor'] = hypervisor
 470            template = self.grub2.get_multiboot_iso_template(
 471                self.failsafe_boot, has_graphics, has_serial,
 472                self.mediacheck_boot, self._has_btrfs_relative_path()
 473            )
 474        else:
 475            log.info('--> Using standard boot template')
 476            template = self.grub2.get_iso_template(
 477                self.failsafe_boot, has_graphics, has_serial,
 478                self.mediacheck_boot, self._has_btrfs_relative_path()
 479            )
 480        try:
 481            self.config = template.substitute(parameters)
 482        except Exception as e:
 483            raise KiwiTemplateError(
 484                f'{type(e).__name__}: {format(e)}'
 485            )
 486        if self.firmware.efi_mode() and self.early_boot_script_efi:
 487            self._copy_grub_config_to_efi_path(
 488                self.boot_dir, self.early_boot_script_efi, 'iso'
 489            )

 491    def setup_install_boot_images(
 492        self, mbrid: SystemIdentifier, lookup_path: str = None
 493    ) -> None:
 494        """
 495        Create/Provide grub2 boot images and metadata
 496
 497        In order to boot from the ISO grub2 modules, images and theme
 498        data needs to be created and provided at the correct place on
 499        the iso filesystem
 500
 501        :param string mbrid: mbrid file name on boot device
 502        :param string lookup_path: custom module lookup path
 503        """
 504        log.info('Creating grub2 bootloader images')
 505        if self.firmware.efi_mode():
 506            self.efi_boot_path = self.create_efi_path(in_sub_dir='')
 507
 508        log.info('--> Creating identifier file %s', mbrid.get_id())
 509        grub_boot_path = self._get_grub2_boot_path()
 510        Path.create(
 511            grub_boot_path
 512        )
 513        mbrid.write(
 514            self.boot_dir + '/boot/' + mbrid.get_id()
 515        )
 516        mbrid.write(
 517            self.boot_dir + '/boot/mbrid'
 518        )
 519
 520        self._copy_theme_data_to_boot_directory(lookup_path, 'iso')
 521
 522        if self._supports_platform_modules():
 523            self._copy_bios_modules_to_boot_directory(lookup_path)
 524            self._setup_platform_image(mbrid=mbrid, lookup_path=lookup_path)
 525
 526        if self.firmware.efi_mode():
 527            self._setup_EFI_path(lookup_path)
 528
 529        if self.firmware.efi_mode() == 'efi':
 530            self._setup_efi_image(
 531                mbrid=mbrid, lookup_path=lookup_path, target_type='iso'
 532            )
 533            self._copy_efi_modules_to_boot_directory(lookup_path)
 534        elif self.firmware.efi_mode() == 'uefi':
 535            self._setup_secure_boot_efi_image(
 536                lookup_path=lookup_path, mbrid=mbrid, target_type='iso'
 537            )
 538
 539        log.info('--> Creating loopback config')
 540        loopback_file = os.path.normpath(
 541            os.sep.join([grub_boot_path, 'loopback.cfg'])
 542        )
 543        self._create_loopback_config(
 544            loopback_file
 545        )
 546
 547    def setup_live_boot_images(self, mbrid: SystemIdentifier, lookup_path=None):
 548        """
 549        Create/Provide grub2 boot images and metadata
 550
 551        Calls setup_install_boot_images because no different action required
 552        """
 553        self.setup_install_boot_images(mbrid, lookup_path)
 554
 555    def setup_disk_boot_images(
 556        self, boot_uuid, efi_uuid=None, lookup_path=None
 557    ):
 558        """
 559        Create/Provide grub2 boot images and metadata
 560
 561        In order to boot from the disk grub2 modules, images and theme
 562        data needs to be created and provided at the correct place in
 563        the filesystem
 564
 565        :param string boot_uuid: boot device UUID
 566        :param string lookup_path: custom module lookup path
 567        """
 568        log.info('Creating grub2 bootloader images')
 569
 570        if self.firmware.efi_mode():
 571            self.efi_boot_path = self.create_efi_path()
 572
 573        self._copy_theme_data_to_boot_directory(lookup_path, 'disk')
 574
 575        if not self.xen_guest and self._supports_platform_modules():
 576            self._copy_bios_modules_to_boot_directory(lookup_path)
 577
 578        if self.firmware.efi_mode() == 'efi':
 579            self._setup_efi_image(
 580                uuid=boot_uuid, efi_uuid=efi_uuid, lookup_path=lookup_path
 581            )
 582            self._copy_efi_modules_to_boot_directory(lookup_path)
 583        elif self.firmware.efi_mode() == 'uefi':
 584            if not self._get_shim_install():
 585                self._setup_secure_boot_efi_image(
 586                    lookup_path=lookup_path, uuid=boot_uuid, efi_uuid=efi_uuid
 587                )
 588
 589        if self.xen_guest:
 590            self._copy_xen_modules_to_boot_directory(lookup_path)
 591
 592    def _copy_grub_config_to_efi_path(
 593        self, root_path, config_file, target_type='disk'
 594    ):
 595        efi_boot_path = Defaults.get_shim_vendor_directory(
 596            root_path
 597        )
 598        if not efi_boot_path:
 599            # not all distributors installs a vendor directory but
 600            # have them in their encoded early boot script. Thus
 601            # the following code tries to look up the vendor string
 602            # from the signed grub binary
 603            grub_images = Defaults.get_signed_grub_loader(
 604                self.root_dir, target_type
 605            )
 606            for grub_image in grub_images:
 607                if grub_image and grub_image.filename:
 608                    strings_abspath = Path.which(
 609                        'strings', access_mode=os.X_OK
 610                    )
 611                    if not strings_abspath:
 612                        raise KiwiCommandNotFound(
 613                            'strings command not found on buildhost'
 614                        )
 615                    bash_command = [
 616                        strings_abspath,
 617                        grub_image.filename, '|', 'grep', r'EFI\/'
 618                    ]
 619                    efi_boot_path = Command.run(
 620                        ['bash', '-c', ' '.join(bash_command)],
 621                        raise_on_error=False, raise_on_command_not_found=True
 622                    ).output
 623                    if efi_boot_path:
 624                        efi_boot_path = os.path.normpath(
 625                            os.sep.join([root_path, efi_boot_path.strip()])
 626                        )
 627        if not efi_boot_path:
 628            efi_boot_path = os.path.normpath(
 629                os.sep.join([root_path, 'EFI/BOOT'])
 630            )
 631        Path.create(efi_boot_path)
 632        grub_config_file_for_efi_boot = os.sep.join(
 633            [efi_boot_path, 'grub.cfg']
 634        )
 635        if config_file != grub_config_file_for_efi_boot:
 636            log.info(
 637                'Copying {0} -> {1} to be found by EFI'.format(
 638                    config_file, grub_config_file_for_efi_boot
 639                )
 640            )
 641            shutil.copy2(
 642                config_file, grub_config_file_for_efi_boot
 643            )
 644
 645    def _supports_platform_modules(self):
 646        if self.efi_csm and (
 647            self.arch == 'ix86' or self.arch == 'x86_64' or Defaults.is_ppc64_arch(self.arch)
 648        ):
 649            return True
 650        return False
 651
 652    def _setup_sysconfig_bootloader(self):
 653        """
 654        Create or update etc/sysconfig/bootloader for the following
 655        parameters. Please note this file is consumed by perl-bootloader
 656        only and marked for deletion with the next major release of
 657        kiwi because not a mainline grub config file.
 658
 659        * LOADER_TYPE
 660        * LOADER_LOCATION
 661        * DEFAULT_APPEND
 662        * FAILSAFE_APPEND
 663        * SECURE_BOOT
 664        * TRUSTED_BOOT
 665        """
 666        sysconfig_bootloader_entries = {
 667            'LOADER_TYPE':
 668                'grub2-efi' if self.firmware.efi_mode() else 'grub2',
 669            'LOADER_LOCATION':
 670                'none' if self.firmware.efi_mode() else 'mbr'
 671        }
 672        if self.bls:
 673            sysconfig_bootloader_entries['LOADER_TYPE'] = 'grub2-bls'
 674        if '--set-trusted-boot' in self.config_options:
 675            sysconfig_bootloader_entries['TRUSTED_BOOT'] = 'yes'
 676        if self.firmware.efi_mode() == 'uefi':
 677            sysconfig_bootloader_entries['SECURE_BOOT'] = 'yes'
 678        elif self.firmware.efi_mode() == 'efi':
 679            sysconfig_bootloader_entries['SECURE_BOOT'] = 'no'
 680        if self.cmdline:
 681            sysconfig_bootloader_entries['DEFAULT_APPEND'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 682                self.cmdline
 683            )
 684        if self.cmdline_failsafe:
 685            sysconfig_bootloader_entries['FAILSAFE_APPEND'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 686                self.cmdline_failsafe
 687            )
 688
 689        sysconfig_bootloader_location = ''.join(
 690            [self.root_dir, '/etc/sysconfig/']
 691        )
 692        if os.path.exists(sysconfig_bootloader_location):
 693            log.info('Writing sysconfig bootloader file')
 694            sysconfig_bootloader_file = ''.join(
 695                [sysconfig_bootloader_location, 'bootloader']
 696            )
 697            sysconfig_bootloader = SysConfig(
 698                sysconfig_bootloader_file
 699            )
 700            sysconfig_bootloader_entries_sorted = OrderedDict(
 701                sorted(sysconfig_bootloader_entries.items())
 702            )
 703            for key, value in list(sysconfig_bootloader_entries_sorted.items()):
 704                log.info('--> {0}:{1}'.format(key, value))
 705                sysconfig_bootloader[key] = value
 706            sysconfig_bootloader.write()
 707
 708    def _setup_zipl2grub_conf(self):
 709        zipl2grub_config_file = ''.join(
 710            [self.root_dir, '/etc/default/zipl2grub.conf.in']
 711        )
 712        zipl2grub_config_file_orig = ''.join(
 713            [self.root_dir, '/etc/default/zipl2grub.conf.in.orig']
 714        )
 715        target_type = self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_targettype()
 716        target_blocksize = self.xml_state.build_type.get_target_blocksize()
 717        if target_type and os.path.exists(zipl2grub_config_file):
 718            if os.path.exists(zipl2grub_config_file_orig):
 719                # reset the original template file first
 720                shutil.copy2(zipl2grub_config_file_orig, zipl2grub_config_file)
 721            else:
 722                # no copy of the original template, create it
 723                shutil.copy2(zipl2grub_config_file, zipl2grub_config_file_orig)
 724            with open(zipl2grub_config_file) as zipl_config_file:
 725                zipl_config = zipl_config_file.read()
 726                zipl_config = re.sub(
 727                    r'(:menu)',
 728                    ':menu\n'
 729                    '    targettype = {0}\n'
 730                    '    targetbase = {1}\n'
 731                    '    targetblocksize = {2}\n'
 732                    '    targetoffset = {3}\n'
 733                    '    {4}'.format(
 734                        target_type if target_type != 'GPT' else 'SCSI',
 735                        self.custom_args['targetbase'],
 736                        target_blocksize or 512,
 737                        self._get_partition_start(
 738                            self.custom_args['targetbase']
 739                        ),
 740                        self._get_disk_geometry(
 741                            self.custom_args['targetbase']
 742                        )
 743                    ),
 744                    zipl_config
 745                )
 746            log.debug('Updated zipl template as follows')
 747            with open(zipl2grub_config_file, 'w') as zipl_config_file:
 748                log.debug(zipl_config)
 749                zipl_config_file.write(zipl_config)
 750
 751    def _setup_default_grub(self):
 752        """
 753        Create or update etc/default/grub by parameters required
 754        according to the root filesystem setup
 755
 756        * GRUB_DEFAULT
 757        * GRUB_TIMEOUT
 758        * GRUB_TIMEOUT_STYLE
 759        * SUSE_BTRFS_SNAPSHOT_BOOTING
 760        * SUSE_REMOVE_LINUX_ROOT_PARAM
 761        * GRUB_BACKGROUND
 762        * GRUB_THEME
 763        * GRUB_SERIAL_COMMAND
 764        * GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX
 765        * GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT
 766        * GRUB_GFXMODE
 767        * GRUB_TERMINAL_INPUT
 768        * GRUB_TERMINAL_OUTPUT
 769        * GRUB_DISTRIBUTOR
 770        * GRUB_DISABLE_LINUX_UUID
 771        * GRUB_DISABLE_LINUX_PARTUUID
 772        * GRUB_ENABLE_LINUX_LABEL
 773        """
 774        # elements to set only if not already in etc/default/grub
 775        grub_default_if_not_set_entries = {
 776            'GRUB_DEFAULT': 'saved'
 777        }
 778        # elements to set in any case
 779        grub_default_entries = {
 780            'GRUB_TIMEOUT': self.timeout,
 781            'GRUB_GFXMODE': self.gfxmode
 782        }
 783        if self.terminal_input:
 784            grub_default_entries['GRUB_TERMINAL_INPUT'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 785                self.terminal_input
 786            )
 787        if self.terminal_output:
 788            grub_default_entries['GRUB_TERMINAL_OUTPUT'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 789                self.terminal_output
 790            )
 791        grub_final_cmdline = re.sub(
 792            r'(^root=[^\s]+)|( root=[^\s]+)', '', self.cmdline
 793        ).strip()
 794        if self.persistency_type == 'by-label':
 795            label = re.search(r'(^root=[^\s]+)|( root=[^\s]+)', self.cmdline)
 796            if label:
 797                for match in label.groups():
 798                    if match and 'LABEL' in match:
 799                        grub_default_entries['GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX'] = \
 800                            '"{0}"'.format(match.strip())
 801                        grub_default_entries['SUSE_REMOVE_LINUX_ROOT_PARAM'] = \
 802                            'true'
 803            grub_default_entries['GRUB_ENABLE_LINUX_LABEL'] = 'true'
 804            grub_default_entries['GRUB_DISABLE_LINUX_UUID'] = 'true'
 805        elif self.persistency_type == 'by-partuuid':
 806            grub_default_entries['GRUB_DISABLE_LINUX_UUID'] = 'true'
 807            grub_default_entries['GRUB_DISABLE_LINUX_PARTUUID'] = 'false'
 808        if self.displayname:
 809            grub_default_entries['GRUB_DISTRIBUTOR'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 810                self.displayname
 811            )
 812        if self.timeout_style:
 813            grub_default_entries['GRUB_TIMEOUT_STYLE'] = self.timeout_style
 814        if grub_final_cmdline:
 815            grub_default_entries['GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 816                grub_final_cmdline
 817            )
 818        if self.serial_line_setup and \
 819           ('serial' in self.terminal_input or 'serial' in self.terminal_output):
 820            grub_default_entries['GRUB_SERIAL_COMMAND'] = '"{0}"'.format(
 821                self.serial_line_setup
 822            )
 823        if self.theme:
 824            theme_setup = '{0}/{1}/theme.txt'
 825            grub_default_entries['GRUB_THEME'] = theme_setup.format(
 826                ''.join(['/boot/', self.boot_directory_name, '/themes']),
 827                self.theme
 828            )
 829            theme_background = '{0}/{1}/background.png'.format(
 830                ''.join(['/boot/', self.boot_directory_name, '/themes']),
 831                self.theme
 832            )
 833            if os.path.exists(os.sep.join([self.root_dir, theme_background])):
 834                grub_default_entries['GRUB_BACKGROUND'] = theme_background
 835        if self.xml_state.build_type.get_btrfs_root_is_snapper_snapshot():
 836            grub_default_entries['SUSE_BTRFS_SNAPSHOT_BOOTING'] = 'true'
 837        if self.custom_args.get('crypto_disk'):
 838            grub_default_entries['GRUB_ENABLE_CRYPTODISK'] = 'y'
 839
 840        enable_blscfg_implemented = Command.run(
 841            [
 842                'grep', '-q', 'GRUB_ENABLE_BLSCFG',
 843                self._get_grub2_mkconfig_tool()
 844            ], raise_on_error=False
 845        )
 846        if self.bls and enable_blscfg_implemented.returncode == 0:
 847            grub_default_entries['GRUB_ENABLE_BLSCFG'] = 'true'
 848
 849        if self.arch.startswith('s390') and self.host_key_certificates:
 850            # At the moment no generic enabler for secure execution
 851            # on s390 exists in grub upstream. Thus the following
 852            # variable setup is distribution specific:
 853            # Enable Secure Execution: SUSE specific variables
 854            host_key_list = []
 855            signing_key_list = []
 856            revocation_key_list = []
 857            grub_default_entries['SUSE_S390_SE_ENABLE'] = 'true'
 858            grub_default_entries['SUSE_S390_SE_CA_CERT'] = \
 859                self.host_key_certificates[0]['hkd_ca_cert']
 860            for host_key_certificate in self.host_key_certificates:
 861                signing_key_list.append(host_key_certificate['hkd_sign_cert'])
 862                host_key_list += host_key_certificate['hkd_cert']
 863                if host_key_certificate.get('hkd_revocation_list'):
 864                    revocation_key_list += \
 865                        host_key_certificate['hkd_revocation_list']
 866            grub_default_entries['SUSE_S390_SE_HOST_KEY'] = \
 867                ','.join(host_key_list)
 868            grub_default_entries['SUSE_S390_SE_HOST_KEY_SIGNING_KEY'] = \
 869                ','.join(signing_key_list)
 870            if revocation_key_list:
 871                grub_default_entries['SUSE_S390_SE_REVOCATION_LIST'] = \
 872                    ','.join(revocation_key_list)
 873
 874        if grub_default_entries:
 875            log.info('Writing grub2 defaults file')
 876            grub_default_location = ''.join([self.root_dir, '/etc/default/'])
 877            if os.path.exists(grub_default_location):
 878                grub_default_file = ''.join([grub_default_location, 'grub'])
 879                grub_default = SysConfig(grub_default_file)
 880                grub_default_entries_sorted = OrderedDict(
 881                    sorted(grub_default_entries.items())
 882                )
 883                for key, value in list(grub_default_entries_sorted.items()):
 884                    log.info('--> {0}:{1}'.format(key, value))
 885                    grub_default[key] = value
 886                grub_default_if_not_set_entries_sorted = OrderedDict(
 887                    sorted(grub_default_if_not_set_entries.items())
 888                )
 889                for key, value in list(grub_default_if_not_set_entries_sorted.items()):
 890                    if not grub_default.get(key):
 891                        log.info('--> {0}:{1}'.format(key, value))
 892                        grub_default[key] = value
 893                grub_default.write()
 894
 895    def _setup_secure_boot_efi_image(
 896        self, lookup_path, uuid=None, efi_uuid=None,
 897        mbrid=None, target_type='disk'
 898    ):
 899        """
 900        Provide the shim loader and the shim signed grub2 loader
 901        in the required boot path. Normally this task is done by
 902        the shim-install tool. However, shim-install does not exist
 903        on all distributions and the script does not operate well
 904        in e.g CD environments from which we generate live and/or
 905        install media. Thus shim-install is used if possible at
 906        install time of the bootloader because it requires access
 907        to the target block device. In any other case this setup
 908        code should act as the fallback solution
 909        """
 910        log.warning(
 911            'Running fallback setup for shim secure boot efi image'
 912        )
 913        if not lookup_path:
 914            lookup_path = self.boot_dir
 915        grub_images = Defaults.get_signed_grub_loader(lookup_path, target_type)
 916        shim_images = Defaults.get_shim_loader(lookup_path)
 917        if not grub_images:
 918            raise KiwiBootLoaderGrubSecureBootError(
 919                'Signed grub2 efi loader not found'
 920            )
 921        # The shim concept is based on a two step system including a
 922        # grub image(shim) that got signed by Microsoft followed by
 923        # a grub image that got signed by the shim. The shim image
 924        # is the one that gets loaded by the firmware which itself
 925        # loads the second stage grub image
 926        for grub_image in grub_images:
 927            if grub_image.binaryname:
 928                if shim_images:
 929                    target_grub_image_name = os.sep.join(
 930                        [self.efi_boot_path, grub_image.binaryname]
 931                    )
 932                else:
 933                    # Without shim a self signed grub image is used that
 934                    # gets loaded by the firmware
 935                    target_grub_image_name = os.sep.join(
 936                        [self.efi_boot_path, grub_image.targetname]
 937                    )
 938                if not os.path.isfile(target_grub_image_name):
 939                    log.info(
 940                        f'--> Using grub image: {grub_image.filename}'
 941                    )
 942                    Command.run(
 943                        ['cp', grub_image.filename, target_grub_image_name]
 944                    )
 945        for shim_image in shim_images:
 946            if shim_image.filename:
 947                target_efi_image_name = os.sep.join(
 948                    [self.efi_boot_path, shim_image.binaryname]
 949                )
 950                if not os.path.isfile(target_efi_image_name):
 951                    log.info(
 952                        f'--> Using shim image: {shim_image.filename}'
 953                    )
 954                    Command.run(
 955                        ['cp', shim_image.filename, target_efi_image_name]
 956                    )
 957        # mok manager
 958        mok_managers = Defaults.get_mok_manager(lookup_path)
 959        if mok_managers and shim_images:
 960            for mok_manager in mok_managers:
 961                target_mok_manager = os.sep.join(
 962                    [self.efi_boot_path, os.path.basename(mok_manager)]
 963                )
 964                if not os.path.isfile(target_mok_manager):
 965                    log.info(
 966                        f'--> Using mok image: {mok_manager}'
 967                    )
 968                    Command.run(
 969                        ['cp', mok_manager, self.efi_boot_path]
 970                    )
 971        self._create_efi_config_search(uuid, efi_uuid, mbrid)
 972
 973    def _setup_efi_image(
 974        self, uuid=None, efi_uuid=None, mbrid=None,
 975        lookup_path=None, target_type='disk'
 976    ):
 977        """
 978        Provide the unsigned grub2 efi image in the required boot path
 979        If a prebuilt efi image as provided by the distribution could
 980        be found, this image will be used. If no such image could be
 981        found we create a custom image with a pre defined set of
 982        grub modules
 983        """
 984        if not lookup_path:
 985            lookup_path = self.boot_dir
 986        grub_images = Defaults.get_unsigned_grub_loader(
 987            lookup_path, target_type
 988        )
 989        can_write = self.xml_state.build_type.get_overlayroot_write_partition()
 990        if grub_images and can_write is not False:
 991            for grub_image in grub_images:
 992                log.info(f'--> Using prebuilt unsigned efi image: {grub_image}')
 993                target_grub_image_name = os.sep.join(
 994                    [self.efi_boot_path, grub_image.targetname]
 995                )
 996                Command.run(
 997                    ['cp', grub_image.filename, target_grub_image_name]
 998                )
 999            self._create_efi_config_search(uuid, efi_uuid, mbrid)
1000        else:
1001            log.info('--> Creating unsigned efi image')
1002            self._create_efi_image(
1003                uuid, efi_uuid, mbrid, lookup_path
1004            )
1005
1006    def _setup_chrp_config(self, mbrid):
1007        early_boot_script = os.path.normpath(
1008            os.sep.join(
1009                [self._get_grub2_boot_path(), 'powerpc-ieee1275', 'grub.cfg']
1010            )
1011        )
1012        self._create_early_boot_script_for_mbrid_search(
1013            early_boot_script, mbrid
1014        )
1015        chrp_dir = os.path.normpath(os.sep.join([self.boot_dir, 'ppc']))
1016        Path.create(chrp_dir)
1017        chrp_bootinfo_file = os.sep.join([chrp_dir, 'bootinfo.txt'])
1018        chrp_config = dedent('''
1019            <chrp-boot>
1020            <description>{os_name}</description>
1021            <os-name>{os_name}</os-name>
1022            <boot-script>boot &device;:1,\\boot\\grub2\\powerpc-ieee1275\\{chrp_loader}</boot-script>
1023            </chrp-boot>
1024        ''').strip() + os.linesep
1025        with open(chrp_bootinfo_file, 'w') as chrp_bootinfo:
1026            chrp_bootinfo.write(
1027                chrp_config.format(
1028                    os_name=self.get_menu_entry_install_title(),
1029                    chrp_loader=Defaults.get_grub_chrp_loader(self.boot_dir)
1030                )
1031            )
1032
1033    def _setup_platform_image(self, mbrid, lookup_path=None):
1034        """
1035        Provide bios grub image
1036        """
1037        if not lookup_path:
1038            lookup_path = self.boot_dir
1039        grub_image = Defaults.get_grub_platform_core_loader(lookup_path)
1040        if grub_image:
1041            log.info(f'--> Using prebuilt bios image: {grub_image}')
1042        else:
1043            log.info('--> Creating bios image')
1044            self._create_platform_image(
1045                mbrid, lookup_path
1046            )
1047        if Defaults.is_ppc64_arch(Defaults.get_platform_name()):
1048            self._setup_chrp_config(mbrid)
1049            return
1050        bash_command = ' '.join(
1051            [
1052                'cat',
1053                self._get_grub_platform_modules_path(
1054                    lookup_path
1055                ) + '/cdboot.img',
1056                grub_image or self._get_grub_platform_image_name(lookup_path),
1057                '>',
1058                os.sep.join(
1059                    [
1060                        self._get_grub_platform_modules_path(lookup_path),
1061                        Defaults.get_iso_grub_loader()
1062                    ]
1063                )
1064            ]
1065        )
1066        Command.run(
1067            ['bash', '-c', bash_command]
1068        )
1069
1070    def _create_embedded_fat_efi_image(self, path):
1071        """
1072        Creates a EFI system partition image at the given path.
1073        Must be called after setup_install_boot_images and write.
1074        """
1075        fat_image_mbsize = int(
1076            self.xml_state.build_type
1077                .get_efifatimagesize() or defaults.EFI_FAT_IMAGE_SIZE
1078        )
1079        efi_folder = Temporary(prefix='efi_folder').new_dir()
1080        efi_data = DataSync(self.boot_dir + '/EFI/', efi_folder.name)
1081        efi_data.sync_data(
1082            options=Defaults.get_sync_options(),
1083            exclude=Defaults.get_exclude_list_from_custom_exclude_files_for_efifatimage(self.root_dir)
1084        )
1085        Command.run(
1086            ['qemu-img', 'create', path, f'{fat_image_mbsize}M']
1087        )
1088        Command.run(
1089            ['mkdosfs', '-n', 'BOOT', path]
1090        )
1091        Command.run(
1092            [
1093                'mcopy', '-Do', '-s', '-i', path,
1094                efi_folder.name, '::EFI'
1095            ]
1096        )
1097
1098    def _create_efi_image(
1099        self, uuid=None, efi_uuid=None, mbrid=None, lookup_path=None
1100    ):
1101        dracut_setup = self.xml_state.get_dracut_config('setup')
1102        early_boot_script = os.path.normpath(
1103            os.sep.join([self.efi_boot_path, 'earlyboot.cfg'])
1104        )
1105        self.early_boot_script_efi = early_boot_script
1106        if dracut_setup.uefi and efi_uuid:
1107            self._create_early_boot_script_for_uki_chainload(
1108                early_boot_script, efi_uuid
1109            )
1110        elif uuid:
1111            self._create_early_boot_script_for_uuid_search(
1112                early_boot_script, uuid
1113            )
1114        else:
1115            self._create_early_boot_script_for_mbrid_search(
1116                early_boot_script, mbrid
1117            )
1118        root_efi_path = '/boot/efi/EFI/BOOT/'
1119        root_efi_image = root_efi_path + Defaults.get_efi_image_name(self.arch)
1120
1121        Path.create(self.root_dir + root_efi_path)
1122
1123        module_list = Defaults.get_grub_efi_modules(multiboot=self.xen_guest)
1124        module_path = self._get_efi_modules_path(self.root_dir)
1125        if os.path.exists(module_path + '/linuxefi.mod'):
1126            module_list.append('linuxefi')
1127
1128        early_boot_script_on_media = \
1129            self.root_dir + root_efi_path + 'earlyboot.cfg'
1130        if early_boot_script != early_boot_script_on_media:
1131            log.debug(
1132                f'Copy earlyboot to media path: {early_boot_script_on_media}'
1133            )
1134            shutil.copy2(
1135                early_boot_script, early_boot_script_on_media
1136            )
1137        mkimage_call = Command.run(
1138            [
1139                'chroot', self.root_dir,
1140                os.path.basename(
1141                    self._get_grub2_mkimage_tool()
1142                ) or 'grub2-mkimage',
1143                '-O', Defaults.get_efi_module_directory_name(self.arch),
1144                '-o', root_efi_image,
1145                '-c', root_efi_path + 'earlyboot.cfg',
1146                '-p', os.path.join(self.get_boot_path(), self.boot_directory_name),
1147                '-d', module_path.replace(self.root_dir, '')
1148            ] + module_list
1149        )
1150        log.debug(mkimage_call.output)
1151
1152        # Copy generated EFI image to the media directory if this
1153        # is different from the system root directory, e.g the case
1154        # for live image builds or when using a custom kiwi initrd
1155        efi_image_root_file = self.root_dir + root_efi_image
1156        efi_image_media_file = os.sep.join(
1157            [self.efi_boot_path, os.path.basename(efi_image_root_file)]
1158        )
1159        if (efi_image_root_file != efi_image_media_file):
1160            log.debug(
1161                f'Copy grub image to media path: {efi_image_media_file}'
1162            )
1163            Path.create(os.path.dirname(efi_image_media_file))
1164            shutil.copy2(efi_image_root_file, efi_image_media_file)
1165
1166    def _create_efi_config_search(self, uuid=None, efi_uuid=None, mbrid=None):
1167        dracut_setup = self.xml_state.get_dracut_config('setup')
1168        efi_boot_config = self.efi_boot_path + '/grub.cfg'
1169        self.early_boot_script_efi = efi_boot_config
1170        if dracut_setup.uefi and efi_uuid:
1171            self._create_early_boot_script_for_uki_chainload(
1172                efi_boot_config, efi_uuid
1173            )
1174        elif uuid:
1175            self._create_early_boot_script_for_uuid_search(
1176                efi_boot_config, uuid
1177            )
1178        else:
1179            self._create_early_boot_script_for_mbrid_search(
1180                efi_boot_config, mbrid
1181            )
1182
1183    def _create_platform_image(self, mbrid, lookup_path=None):
1184        early_boot_script = os.path.normpath(
1185            os.sep.join([self._get_grub2_boot_path(), 'earlyboot.cfg'])
1186        )
1187        self._create_early_boot_script_for_mbrid_search(
1188            early_boot_script, mbrid
1189        )
1190        early_boot_script_on_media = os.sep.join(
1191            [self.root_dir, 'boot', self.boot_directory_name, 'earlyboot.cfg']
1192        )
1193        if early_boot_script != early_boot_script_on_media:
1194            log.debug(
1195                f'Copy earlyboot to media path: {early_boot_script_on_media}'
1196            )
1197            Path.create(
1198                os.path.dirname(early_boot_script_on_media)
1199            )
1200            shutil.copy2(
1201                early_boot_script, early_boot_script_on_media
1202            )
1203        mkimage_call = Command.run(
1204            [
1205                'chroot', self.root_dir,
1206                os.path.basename(
1207                    self._get_grub2_mkimage_tool()
1208                ) or 'grub2-mkimage',
1209                '-O', Defaults.get_grub_platform_module_directory_name(),
1210                '-o', self._get_grub_platform_image_name(self.root_dir).replace(
1211                    self.root_dir, ''
1212                ),
1213                '-c', early_boot_script.replace(self.boot_dir, ''),
1214                '-p', os.sep.join(
1215                    [self.get_boot_path(), self.boot_directory_name]
1216                ),
1217                '-d', self._get_grub_platform_modules_path(
1218                    self.root_dir
1219                ).replace(self.root_dir, '')
1220            ] + Defaults.get_grub_platform_modules(multiboot=self.xen_guest)
1221        )
1222        log.debug(mkimage_call.output)
1223
1224        # Copy generated EFI image to the media directory if this
1225        # is different from the system root directory, e.g the case
1226        # for live image builds or when using a custom kiwi initrd
1227        bios_image_root_file = self._get_grub_platform_image_name(self.root_dir)
1228        bios_image_media_file = bios_image_root_file.replace(
1229            self.root_dir, lookup_path
1230        )
1231        if (bios_image_root_file != bios_image_media_file):
1232            log.debug(
1233                f'Copy grub image to media path: {bios_image_media_file}'
1234            )
1235            Path.create(os.path.dirname(bios_image_media_file))
1236            shutil.copy2(bios_image_root_file, bios_image_media_file)
1237
1238    def _create_early_boot_script_for_uki_chainload(self, filename, uuid):
1239        with open(filename, 'w') as early_boot:
1240            early_boot.write(
1241                f'search --no-floppy --set=root --fs-uuid {uuid}{os.linesep}'
1242            )
1243            early_boot.write(
1244                f'chainloader ($root)/EFI/Linux/kiwi.efi{os.linesep}'
1245            )
1246            early_boot.write(f'boot{os.linesep}')
1247
1248    def _create_early_boot_script_for_uuid_search(self, filename, uuid):
1249        with open(filename, 'w') as early_boot:
1250            if self._has_btrfs_relative_path():
1251                early_boot.write(
1252                    'set btrfs_relative_path="yes"{0}'.format(os.linesep)
1253                )
1254            if self.custom_args.get('boot_is_crypto'):
1255                early_boot.write(
1256                    'insmod cryptodisk{0}'.format(os.linesep)
1257                )
1258                early_boot.write(
1259                    'insmod luks{0}'.format(os.linesep)
1260                )
1261                early_boot.write(
1262                    'cryptomount -u {0}{1}'.format(
1263                        uuid.replace('-', ''), os.linesep
1264                    )
1265                )
1266                early_boot.write(
1267                    'set root="cryptouuid/{0}"{1}'.format(
1268                        uuid.replace('-', ''), os.linesep
1269                    )
1270                )
1271            early_boot.write(
1272                'search --fs-uuid --set=root {0}{1}'.format(uuid, os.linesep)
1273            )
1274            early_boot.write(
1275                'set prefix=($root){0}{1}'.format(
1276                    os.path.join(self.get_boot_path(), self.boot_directory_name), os.linesep
1277                )
1278            )
1279            early_boot.write(
1280                '{0} ($root){1}/grub.cfg{2}'.format(self.grub_load, os.path.join(
1281                    self.get_boot_path(), self.boot_directory_name
1282                ), os.linesep)
1283            )
1284
1285    def _create_early_boot_script_for_mbrid_search(self, filename, mbrid):
1286        with open(filename, 'w') as early_boot:
1287            if self._has_btrfs_relative_path():
1288                early_boot.write(
1289                    'set btrfs_relative_path="yes"{0}'.format(os.linesep)
1290                )
1291            if mbrid:
1292                early_boot.write(
1293                    f'search --file --set=root /boot/{mbrid.get_id()}{os.linesep}'
1294                )
1295            else:
1296                # Fallback search for /boot/mbrid
1297                early_boot.write(
1298                    f'search --file --set=root /boot/mbrid{os.linesep}'
1299                )
1300            early_boot.write(
1301                'set prefix=($root)/boot/{0}{1}'.format(
1302                    self.boot_directory_name, os.linesep
1303                )
1304            )
1305            early_boot.write(
1306                '{0} ($root)/boot/{1}/grub.cfg{2}'.format(
1307                    self.grub_load, self.boot_directory_name, os.linesep
1308                )
1309            )

1311    def _get_grub2_mkimage_tool(self) -> str:
1312        grub_mkimage_file_path = ''
1313        for grub_mkimage_tool in ['grub2-mkimage', 'grub-mkimage']:
1314            grub_mkimage_file_path = Path.which(
1315                grub_mkimage_tool, root_dir=self.root_dir
1316            ) or ''
1317            if grub_mkimage_file_path:
1318                break
1319        return grub_mkimage_file_path
1320
1321    def _get_grub2_mkconfig_tool(self) -> str:
1322        grub_mkconfig_file_path = ''
1323        for grub_mkconfig_tool in ['grub2-mkconfig', 'grub-mkconfig']:
1324            grub_mkconfig_file_path = Path.which(
1325                grub_mkconfig_tool, root_dir=self.root_dir
1326            ) or ''
1327            if grub_mkconfig_file_path:
1328                break
1329        return grub_mkconfig_file_path

1331    def _get_grub2_boot_path(self):
1332        return self.boot_dir + '/boot/' + self.boot_directory_name

1371    def _find_theme_background_file(self, lookup_path):
1372        background_pattern = os.sep.join(
1373            [
1374                lookup_path, 'boot', self.boot_directory_name, 'themes',
1375                '*', 'background.png'
1376            ]
1377        )
1378        for background_file in glob.iglob(background_pattern):
1379            return background_file
1380
1381    def _copy_theme_data_to_boot_directory(self, lookup_path, target):
1382        if not lookup_path:
1383            lookup_path = self.boot_dir
1384        font_name = 'unicode.pf2'
1385        efi_font_dir = Defaults.get_grub_efi_font_directory(
1386            lookup_path
1387        )
1388        boot_fonts_dir = os.path.normpath(
1389            os.sep.join(
1390                [
1391                    self.boot_dir,
1392                    self.get_boot_path(target),
1393                    self.boot_directory_name,
1394                    'fonts'
1395                ]
1396            )
1397        )
1398        try:
1399            unicode_font = Defaults.get_grub_path(
1400                lookup_path, font_name
1401            )
1402            if not os.path.exists(os.sep.join([boot_fonts_dir, font_name])):
1403                Path.create(boot_fonts_dir)
1404                Command.run(
1405                    ['cp', unicode_font, boot_fonts_dir]
1406                )
1407            if efi_font_dir:
1408                Command.run(
1409                    ['cp', unicode_font, efi_font_dir]
1410                )
1411        except Exception as issue:
1412            raise KiwiBootLoaderGrubFontError(
1413                'Setting up unicode font failed with {0}'.format(issue)
1414            )
1415
1416        boot_theme_dir = os.sep.join(
1417            [self.boot_dir, 'boot', self.boot_directory_name, 'themes']
1418        )
1419        Path.create(boot_theme_dir)
1420
1421        if self.theme:
1422            theme_dir = Defaults.get_grub_path(
1423                lookup_path, 'themes/' + self.theme, raise_on_error=False
1424            )
1425            boot_theme_background_file = self._find_theme_background_file(
1426                lookup_path
1427            )
1428            if theme_dir and os.path.exists(theme_dir):
1429                if boot_theme_background_file:
1430                    # A background file was found. Preserve a copy of the
1431                    # file which was created at install time of the theme
1432                    # package by the activate-theme script
1433                    boot_theme_background_backup_file = os.sep.join(
1434                        [self.boot_dir, 'background.png']
1435                    )
1436                    Command.run(
1437                        [
1438                            'cp', boot_theme_background_file,
1439                            boot_theme_background_backup_file
1440                        ]
1441                    )
1442                # sync theme data from install path to boot path
1443                data = DataSync(
1444                    theme_dir, boot_theme_dir
1445                )
1446                data.sync_data(
1447                    options=['-a']
1448                )
1449                if boot_theme_background_file:
1450                    # Install preserved background file to the theme
1451                    Command.run(
1452                        [
1453                            'mv', boot_theme_background_backup_file,
1454                            os.sep.join([boot_theme_dir, self.theme])
1455                        ]
1456                    )
1457            elif boot_theme_background_file:
1458                # assume all theme data is in the directory of the
1459                # background file and just sync that directory to the
1460                # boot path
1461                data = DataSync(
1462                    os.path.dirname(boot_theme_background_file), boot_theme_dir
1463                )
1464                data.sync_data(
1465                    options=['-a']
1466                )
1467
1468        self._check_boot_theme_exists()
1469
1470    def _check_boot_theme_exists(self):
1471        if self.theme:
1472            theme_dir = os.sep.join(
1473                [
1474                    self.boot_dir, 'boot', self.boot_directory_name,
1475                    'themes', self.theme
1476                ]
1477            )
1478            if not os.path.exists(theme_dir):
1479                log.warning('Theme %s not found', theme_dir)
1480                log.warning('Set bootloader terminal to console mode')
1481                self.terminal_input = 'console'
1482                self.terminal_output = 'console'
1483
1484    def _setup_EFI_path(self, lookup_path):
1485        """
1486        Copy efi boot data from lookup_path to the root directory
1487        """
1488        if not lookup_path:
1489            lookup_path = self.boot_dir
1490        efi_path = lookup_path + '/boot/efi/'
1491        if os.path.exists(efi_path):
1492            efi_data = DataSync(efi_path, self.boot_dir)
1493            efi_data.sync_data(options=['-a'])

1517    def _copy_modules_to_boot_directory_from(self, module_path):
1518        boot_module_path = \
1519            self._get_grub2_boot_path() + '/' + os.path.basename(module_path)
1520        try:
1521            data = DataSync(
1522                module_path + '/', boot_module_path
1523            )
1524            data.sync_data(
1525                options=['-a'], exclude=['*.module']
1526            )
1527        except Exception as e:
1528            raise KiwiBootLoaderGrubModulesError(
1529                f'Module synchronisation failed with: {format(e)}'
1530            )

1532    def _get_shim_install(self):

1535        )

1537    def _fix_grub_root_device_reference(self, config_file, boot_options):
1538        if self.root_reference:
1539            # grub2-mkconfig has no idea how the correct root= setup is
1540            # for disk images created with overlayroot enabled or in a
1541            # buildservice worker environment. Because of that the mkconfig
1542            # tool just finds the raw partition loop device and includes it
1543            # which is wrong. In this particular case we have to patch the
1544            # written config file and replace the wrong root= reference with
1545            # the correct value.
1546            with open(config_file) as grub_config_file:
1547                grub_config = grub_config_file.read()
1548                # The following expression matches any of the following
1549                # grub mkconfig root= settings and replaces it with a
1550                # correct value
1551                # 1. root=LOCAL-KIWI-MAPPED-DEVICE
1552                # 2. root=[a-zA-Z]=ANY-LINUX-BY-ID-VALUE
1553                grub_config = re.sub(
1554                    r'(root=[a-zA-Z]+=[a-zA-Z0-9:\.-]+)|(root={0})'.format(
1555                        boot_options.get('root_device')
1556                    ),
1557                    '{0}'.format(self.root_reference),
1558                    grub_config
1559                )
1560
1561            try:
1562                with open(config_file, 'w') as grub_config_file:
1563                    grub_config_file.write(grub_config)
1564            except OSError as issue:
1565                log.warning(f'{func_name()} skipped: {issue}')
1566                return
1567
1568            if self.firmware.efi_mode():
1569                vendor_grubenv_file = \
1570                    Defaults.get_vendor_grubenv(self.efi_mount.mountpoint)
1571                if vendor_grubenv_file:
1572                    with open(vendor_grubenv_file) as vendor_grubenv:
1573                        grubenv = vendor_grubenv.read()
1574                        grubenv = grubenv.replace(
1575                            'root={0}'.format(
1576                                boot_options.get('root_device')
1577                            ),
1578                            self.root_reference
1579                        )
1580                    with open(vendor_grubenv_file, 'w') as vendor_grubenv:
1581                        vendor_grubenv.write(grubenv)
1582
1583    def _fix_grub_loader_entries_boot_cmdline(self):
1584        if self.cmdline:
1585            # For distributions that follows the bootloader spec here:
1586            # https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Specifications/BootLoaderSpec
1587            # the menu entries are managed in extra files written to
1588            # boot/loader/entries. The grub2-mkconfig tool imports the
1589            # information from there and has no own menu entries data
1590            # in grub.cfg anymore. Unfortunately the system that writes
1591            # those new boot/loader/entries has several issues. It produces
1592            # a complete mess when used in chroot environments. In such
1593            # an environment it takes the proc/cmdline data from the host
1594            # that built the image and completely ignores the setup of
1595            # the image description. Overall for image building the
1596            # tooling is completely broken and we are forced to patch the
1597            # entire cmdline for the menuentries on such systems.
1598            loader_entries_pattern = os.sep.join(
1599                [
1600                    self.root_mount.mountpoint,
1601                    'boot', 'loader', 'entries', '*.conf'
1602                ]
1603            )
1604            for menu_entry_file in glob.iglob(loader_entries_pattern):
1605                with open(menu_entry_file) as grub_menu_entry_file:
1606                    menu_entry = grub_menu_entry_file.read()
1607                    menu_entry = re.sub(
1608                        r'options (.*)',
1609                        r'options {0}'.format(self.cmdline),
1610                        menu_entry
1611                    )
1612                try:
1613                    with open(menu_entry_file, 'w') as grub_menu_entry_file:
1614                        grub_menu_entry_file.write(menu_entry)
1615                except OSError as issue:
1616                    log.warning(f'{func_name()} skipped: {issue}')
1617                    return
1618
1619    def _fix_grub_loader_entries_linux_and_initrd_paths(self):
1620        # For the same reasons encoded in _fix_grub_loader_entries_boot_cmdline
1621        # this method exists. In this method the wrong paths to the linux
1622        # kernel and initrd gets fixed
1623        loader_entries_pattern = os.sep.join(
1624            [
1625                self.root_mount.mountpoint,
1626                'boot', 'loader', 'entries', '*.conf'
1627            ]
1628        )
1629        for menu_entry_file in glob.iglob(loader_entries_pattern):
1630            with open(menu_entry_file) as grub_menu_entry_file:
1631                menu_entry = grub_menu_entry_file.read().split(os.linesep)
1632
1633            for line_number, menu_entry_line in enumerate(menu_entry):
1634                if bool(re.match(r'^(linux|initrd) .*', menu_entry_line)):
1635
1636                    log.debug(f'Existing loader entry: {menu_entry_line}')
1637                    config_path = menu_entry_line.split(' ', 1)[0]
1638
1639                    basename = os.path.basename(menu_entry_line)
1640                    if self.bootpartition:
1641                        config_path = (f'{config_path} /{basename}')
1642                    else:
1643                        config_path = (f'{config_path} /boot/{basename}')
1644
1645                    menu_entry[line_number] = config_path
1646                    log.debug(f'Updated loader entry: {config_path}')
1647
1648            menu_entry = os.linesep.join(menu_entry)
1649            try:
1650                with open(menu_entry_file, 'w') as grub_menu_entry_file:
1651                    grub_menu_entry_file.write(menu_entry)
1652            except OSError as issue:
1653                log.warning(f'{func_name()} skipped: {issue}')
1654
1655    def _get_partition_start(self, disk_device):
1656        if self.target_table_type == 'dasd':
1657            blocks = self._get_dasd_disk_geometry_element(
1658                disk_device, 'blocks per track'
1659            )
1660            bash_command = [
1661                'fdasd', '-f', '-s', '-p', disk_device,
1662                '|', 'grep', '"^ "',
1663                '|', 'head', '-n', '1',
1664                '|', 'tr', '-s', '" "'
1665            ]
1666            fdasd_call = Command.run(
1667                ['bash', '-c', ' '.join(bash_command)]
1668            )
1669            fdasd_output = fdasd_call.output
1670            try:
1671                start_track = int(fdasd_output.split(' ')[2].lstrip())
1672            except Exception:
1673                raise KiwiDiskGeometryError(
1674                    f'unknown partition format: {fdasd_output}'
1675                )
1676            return '{0}'.format(start_track * blocks)
1677        else:
1678            bash_command = ' '.join(
1679                [
1680                    'sfdisk', '--dump', disk_device,
1681                    '|', 'grep', '"1 :"',
1682                    '|', 'cut', '-f1', '-d,',
1683                    '|', 'cut', '-f2', '-d='
1684                ]
1685            )
1686            return Command.run(
1687                ['bash', '-c', bash_command]
1688            ).output.strip()
1689
1690    def _get_disk_geometry(self, disk_device):
1691        disk_geometry = ''
1692        if self.target_table_type == 'dasd':
1693            disk_geometry = 'targetgeometry = {0},{1},{2}'.format(
1694                self._get_dasd_disk_geometry_element(
1695                    disk_device, 'cylinders'
1696                ),
1697                self._get_dasd_disk_geometry_element(
1698                    disk_device, 'tracks per cylinder'
1699                ),
1700                self._get_dasd_disk_geometry_element(
1701                    disk_device, 'blocks per track'
1702                )
1703            )
1704        return disk_geometry
1705
1706    def _get_dasd_disk_geometry_element(self, disk_device, search):
1707        fdasd = ['fdasd', '-f', '-p', disk_device]
1708        bash_command = fdasd + ['|', 'grep', '"' + search + '"']
1709        fdasd_call = Command.run(
1710            ['bash', '-c', ' '.join(bash_command)]
1711        )
1712        fdasd_output = fdasd_call.output
1713        try:
1714            return int(fdasd_output.split(':')[1].lstrip())
1715        except Exception:
1716            raise KiwiDiskGeometryError(
1717                f'unknown format for disk geometry: {fdasd_output}'
1718            )
1719
1720    def _create_loopback_config(self, filename):
1721        with open(filename, 'w') as loopback_cfg:
1722            loopback_cfg.write(
1723                'source /boot/{0}/grub.cfg{1}'.format(
1724                    self.boot_directory_name, os.linesep
1725                )
1726            )
1727
1728    def _get_custom_template(self) -> str:
1729        if not self.xml_state.build_type.bootloader:
1730            return ''
1731        template_file = \
1732            self.xml_state.build_type.bootloader[0].get_grub_template()
1733        if not template_file:
1734            return ''
1735        template_path = os.path.join(
1736            os.path.abspath(
1737                self.xml_state.xml_data.description_dir
1738            ),
1739            self.xml_state.build_type.bootloader[0].get_grub_template()
1740        )
1741        if not os.path.exists(template_path):
1742            raise KiwiFileNotFound(
1743                f'failed to locate custom GRUB template {template_file}'
1744            )
1745        return template_path
1746
1747    def _has_btrfs_relative_path(self) -> bool:
1748        if self.xml_state.build_type.get_btrfs_set_default_volume() or \
1749           self.xml_state.build_type.get_btrfs_root_is_snapper_snapshot():
1750            return True
1751        return False
1752
1753    def _setup_loader_variables(self):
1754        """
1755        Run grub2-editenv for writing an updated environment blob
1756        """
1757        if self.root_mount:
1758            variable_list = \
1759                self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_environment_variables()
1760            if variable_list:
1761                log.info(f'Set grub environment variables: {variable_list}')
1762                Command.run(
1763                    [
1764                        'chroot', self.root_mount.mountpoint,
1765                        'grub2-editenv', '-', 'set'
1766                    ] + variable_list
1767                )

def post_init(self, custom_args): 
 68    def post_init(self, custom_args):
 69        """
 70        grub2 post initialization method
 71
 72        :param dict custom_args:
 73            Contains grub config arguments
 74
 75            .. code:: python
 76
 77                {'grub_directory_name': 'grub|grub2'}
 78        """
 79        self.host_key_certificates = self.xml_state.get_host_key_certificates()
 80        self.efi_csm = True if self.xml_state.build_type.get_eficsm() is None \
 81            else self.xml_state.build_type.get_eficsm()
 82        self.custom_args = custom_args
 83        self.config_options = []
 84        arch = Defaults.get_platform_name()
 85        if arch == 'x86_64':
 86            # grub2 support for bios and efi systems
 87            self.arch = arch
 88        elif arch == 'loongarch64':
 89            # grub2 support for efi systems
 90            self.arch = arch
 91        elif arch.startswith('ppc64'):
 92            # grub2 support for ofw and opal systems
 93            self.arch = arch
 94        elif arch == 'ix86':
 95            # grub2 support for bios systems
 96            self.arch = arch
 97        elif arch == 'aarch64' or arch.startswith('arm'):
 98            # grub2 support for efi systems
 99            self.arch = arch
100        elif arch.startswith('s390'):
101            # grub2 support for s390x systems
102            self.arch = arch
103        elif arch == 'riscv64':
104            # grub2 support for efi systems
105            self.arch = arch
106        else:
107            raise KiwiBootLoaderGrubPlatformError(
108                f'host architecture {arch} not supported for grub2 setup'
109            )
110
111        if self.custom_args and 'grub_directory_name' in self.custom_args:
112            self.boot_directory_name = self.custom_args['grub_directory_name']
113        else:
114            self.boot_directory_name = 'grub'
115
116        if self.custom_args and 'grub_load_command' in self.custom_args:
117            self.grub_load = self.custom_args['grub_load_command']
118        else:
119            self.grub_load = 'source'
120
121        if self.custom_args and 'config_options' in self.custom_args:
122            self.config_options = self.custom_args['config_options']
123
124        # This default output terminal type will change to console
125        # with the next major kiwi version update. Also see:
126        # https://github.com/OSInside/kiwi/issues/2494
127        self.terminal_output = \
128            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_console()[0] or 'gfxterm'
129
130        self.terminal_input = \
131            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_console()[1] or 'console'
132
133        self.gfxmode = self.get_gfxmode('grub2')
134        self.theme = self.get_boot_theme()
135        self.timeout = self.get_boot_timeout_seconds()
136        self.bootpartition = self.xml_state.build_type.get_bootpartition()
137        self.timeout_style = \
138            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_timeout_style()
139        self.displayname = self.xml_state.xml_data.get_displayname()
140        self.bls = self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_bls()
141        self.serial_line_setup = \
142            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_serial_line_setup()
143        self.continue_on_timeout = self.get_continue_on_timeout()
144        self.failsafe_boot = self.failsafe_boot_entry_requested()
145        self.mediacheck_boot = self.xml_state.build_type.get_mediacheck()
146        self.xen_guest = self.xml_state.is_xen_guest()
147        self.persistency_type = \
148            self.xml_state.build_type.get_devicepersistency()
149        self.firmware = FirmWare(
150            self.xml_state
151        )
152        self.target_table_type = self.firmware.get_partition_table_type()
153
154        self.live_type = self.xml_state.build_type.get_flags()
155        if not self.live_type:
156            self.live_type = Defaults.get_default_live_iso_type()
157
158        self.volume_id = self.xml_state.build_type.get_volid() or \
159            Defaults.get_volume_id()
160        self.install_volid = self.xml_state.build_type.get_volid() or \
161            Defaults.get_install_volume_id()
162        self.use_disk_password = \
163            self.xml_state.get_build_type_bootloader_use_disk_password()
164
165        self.live_boot_options = [
166            'root=live:CDLABEL={0}'.format(self.volume_id),
167            'rd.live.image'
168        ]
169        self.install_boot_options = [
170            'loglevel=0'
171        ]
172        if self.xml_state.get_initrd_system() == 'dracut':
173            self.install_boot_options.append(
174                'root=install:CDLABEL={0}'.format(self.install_volid)
175            )
176        if self.xml_state.build_type.get_hybridpersistent():
177            self.live_boot_options += \
178                Defaults.get_live_iso_persistent_boot_options(
179                    self.xml_state.build_type.get_hybridpersistent_filesystem()
180                )
181
182        if self.xml_state.is_xen_server():
183            self.multiboot = True
184        elif self.xen_guest:
185            self.multiboot = False
186        else:
187            self.multiboot = False
188
189        self.grub2 = BootLoaderTemplateGrub2()
190        self.config = None
191        self.efi_boot_path = None
192        self.cmdline_failsafe = None
193        self.root_reference = None
194        self.cmdline = None
195        self.iso_boot = False
196        self.early_boot_script_efi = None

def setup_disk_image_config( self, boot_uuid=None, root_uuid=None, hypervisor=None, kernel=None, initrd=None, boot_options={}): 
247    def setup_disk_image_config(
248        self, boot_uuid=None, root_uuid=None, hypervisor=None,
249        kernel=None, initrd=None, boot_options={}
250    ):
251        """
252        Create grub2 config file to boot from disk using grub2-mkconfig
253
254        :param string boot_uuid: unused
255        :param string root_uuid: unused
256        :param string hypervisor: unused
257        :param string kernel: unused
258        :param string initrd: unused
259        :param dict boot_options:
260
261        options dictionary that has to contain the root and boot
262        device and optional volume configuration. KIWI has to
263        mount the system prior to run grub2-mkconfig.
264
265        .. code:: python
266
267            {
268                'root_device': string,
269                'boot_device': string,
270                'efi_device': string,
271                'system_volumes':
272                    volume_manager_instance.get_volumes(),
273                'system_root_volume':
274                    volume_manager_instance.get_root_volume_name()
275            }
276        """
277        self._mount_system(
278            boot_options.get('root_device'),
279            boot_options.get('boot_device'),
280            boot_options.get('efi_device'),
281            boot_options.get('system_volumes'),
282            boot_options.get('system_root_volume')
283        )
284        config_file = os.sep.join(
285            [
286                self.root_mount.mountpoint, 'boot',
287                self.boot_directory_name, 'grub.cfg'
288            ]
289        )
290        # Setup/Update loader environment
291        self._setup_loader_variables()
292
293        # Disable os-prober, it takes information from the host it
294        # runs on which is not necessarily matching with the image
295        os.environ.update({'GRUB_DISABLE_OS_PROBER': 'true'})
296        Command.run(
297            [
298                'chroot', self.root_mount.mountpoint,
299                os.path.basename(self._get_grub2_mkconfig_tool()), '-o',
300                config_file.replace(self.root_mount.mountpoint, '')
301            ], os.environ
302        )
303        if boot_options.get('root_device') != boot_options.get('boot_device'):
304            # Create a boot -> . link on the boot partition.
305            # The link is useful if the grub mkconfig command
306            # references all boot files from /boot/... even if
307            # an extra boot partition should cause it to read the
308            # data from the toplevel
309            bash_command = [
310                'cd', os.sep.join([self.root_mount.mountpoint, 'boot']), '&&',
311                'rm', '-f', 'boot', '&&',
312                'ln', '-s', '.', 'boot'
313            ]
314            # not every filesystem supports symlinks, and the link is optional
315            # therefore don't fail in case the link cannot be created
316            Command.run(
317                ['bash', '-c', ' '.join(bash_command)], raise_on_error=False
318            )
319
320        # Create UKI image if requested
321        dracut_setup = self.xml_state.get_dracut_config('setup')
322        if dracut_setup.uefi:
323            boot_image = boot_options.get('boot_image')
324            if boot_image:
325                efi_uki_path = \
326                    f'{self.root_mount.mountpoint}/boot/efi/EFI/Linux/'
327                Path.create(efi_uki_path)
328                uki_image = boot_image.create_uki(self.cmdline)
329                Command.run(
330                    ['mv', uki_image, efi_uki_path]
331                )
332
333        # Patch the written grub config file to actually work:
334        # Unfortunately the grub tooling has several bugs and issues
335        # which prevents it to work in image build environments.
336        # More details can be found in the individual methods.
337        # One fine day the following fix methods can hopefully
338        # be deleted...
339        self._fix_grub_root_device_reference(config_file, boot_options)
340        self._fix_grub_loader_entries_boot_cmdline()
341        self._fix_grub_loader_entries_linux_and_initrd_paths()
342
343        if self.firmware.efi_mode() and self.early_boot_script_efi:
344            self._copy_grub_config_to_efi_path(
345                self.efi_mount.mountpoint, self.early_boot_script_efi
346            )
347        self._umount_system()
